32935339.review:
[b][h1] É aquele VN que te prende e você nem vê o passar das horas [/h1][/b]

[i] Um breve resumo sobre a trama [/i] : Você é uma garota que perde as memórias ao colidir com o espírito de um [i] shota [/i] garoto-elfo chamado Orion, que estava transitando entre os mundos, e para recuperar suas memórias você e Orion (que agora será seu espírito conselheiro) devem nada mais e nada menos encarar o dia-a-dia sem fazer as pessoas próximas notarem que você está com amnesia ao mesmo tempo que tenta descobrir quem você era.


[b] Minha análise sobre o jogo [/b] : Amnesia conta com gráficos, ilustrações e acabamentos lindíssimos, dublagens (seiyuus) de alta qualidade que mais dá impressão que você está assistindo um anime com dinâmica de VN. Se você for como eu que tem uma preguiça imensa de ler textos e mais textos, não se preocupe, a história muito bem elaborada prenderá sua atenção e conforme se desenrola, você sentirá ansiosidade de saber o que acontecerá com a protagonista e outros envolvidos.
É uma história direcionada para o público feminino (otome), então logo a história será aqueles romances shoujos com dramas e muitos personagens masculinos que agradam a maior parte (se não todos) os gostos das moças de plantão.

[u] ● Para você que assistiu o anime [/u] : Comparar Amnesia VN ao anime é mesma coisa que comparar muitos livros da cultura geek às adaptações hollywoodianas. Aqui na VN você vai descobrir o que acontece em muitos buracos deixados pelo anime, que foi corridíssimo, principalmente na melhor route que é a do Joker. Admito que comprei Amnesia VN só para saber o que acontece que não foi mostrado pelo anime e não me decepcionei nem um pouco.


[i]●Vale a pena fazer badge e/ou platinar?[/i] : Particularmente falando, assim como todo VN, Amnesia é super fácil de platinar porque é um jogo constituído basicamente de escolhas e muita leitura [strike]fora muitos guides pela internet a fora que te ajudam a conseguir os endings mais rápido.[/strike] As badges pelo que eu pesquisei não fornecem backgrounds muito elaborados que vá embelezar seu perfil de forma extravagante, as cartas também são caras, só vale a pena fazer ou upar badge se você realmente quer destacar Amnesia no seu perfil como jogo favorito ou realmente virou super fã.

[b] Contras [/b] : Depois dessa imensa análise positiva desse VN, ele tem algum aspecto negativo? Sim, caro leitor (a), existe! Vamos ser realistas porque nada é perfeito.
 Amnesia tem como contra seus "extras" que por vez foram as sided stories e mini games entediantes. (As galerias de CG estão ok).
Claro que você não compra um VN visando jogar mini games, mas aqui os mini games destacaram-se como entediantes pela falta de elaboração da Idea Factory. Um mini game constituido de jokenpo e air hockey? Isso é super entediante, poderiam ao menos terem feito em gráficos melhores então né Idea? As sided-stories também foram aquele "plus" desnecessário que queriam dar na história, não altera em nada o final, ou seja impacto zero.


[b] Minha avaliação sobre as routes [/b] : Amnesia conta com 4 routes principais (Heart, Spade, Clover e Diamond World) e uma secreta, a Joker World, avaliarei em escala de 1 à 5 cada uma.

32865858.review:
I decided to play this game because I really liked the anime. It seems that’s true of a lot of people who bought it. First of all, I really enjoyed it, however, it is a fairly dark game and people who are easily bothered by such things should be careful. There is a lot of death and many instances of possibly upsetting implications made by the guys. The diamond world is especially upsetting. The characters are all pretty sexist, too.
With that warning done, I had a lot of fun playing this game. Even having watched the anime, there were still things that I found surprising. Kent and Shin's stories where hardly covered at all in the anime so those routes were mostly surprising. Ikki's route was not fully covered, either. Because of the way that the anime tried to show all of the different worlds, some aspects are different as well. I think the game is still worth it to play even after having seen the anime. If you haven't seen the anime then it's probably even more worthwhile, assuming you like this type of dark story. Additionally: I very much do not like romance stories and have no interest in that type of thign. It was the story that I found enjoyable.
In regards to the mechanics, there is A Lot of reading. This type of game is called a visual Novel for a reason. A single route, unless you die early, takes several hours to get through. The only other dating sim I've ever played is mystic messenger which gives significantly more freedom for decision making than Amnesia does. The decisions that cause the most variation in plot are the ones that get you killed. I really liked the background music as well, especially the extra story music.
This game is not for everyone, so I’d recommend being careful, but overall I think it’s a pretty good game and do recommend it.

32658911.review:
(Abuse trigger warnings for this game, FYI)

If you want a good otome where the MC has personality, the story resonates and the characters are attaching, run away. 
BUT if you have a quirky morbid sense of humor, this game is FANTASTIC!

The MC is a brain-damaged piece of tuna who gets tossed into a vat of sharks. To be fair, her passiveness does actually have a plot reason, unlike a lot of other MCs, but that doesn't help your urge to shake her to see if you can hear her brain rattle. Her dazed baby bunny impression just highlights how crazytoons everything else is. Characters are walking tropes dialed up to 11, dressed like renaissance fair addicts who got stranded naked one night in a Hot Topic and had to make do. The story and romances are often plodding, but just as you're nodding off to sleep you'll hit a wrong option and see the bland love story twist and end horribly in a variety of entertaining ways. 

For best effect and an exponential increase in the WTF factor, go through in order of line-up: Start with the verbally and emotionally abusive childhood friend; then the playboy with the supernatural roofie ability; continue on with Borg unit 3 of 5; then the other childhood friend, the sweet, sincere one - oh yeah, definitely go out with that guy. What a keeper! And once you've survived all those yahoos, you unlock the Mystery Dude. IT PUTS THE LOTION ON ITS SKIN! 

Some parts are boring and some are cringeworthy, and a lotta people will find this downright disturbing, but overall I had just as much fun playing this VN as many others, though probably not in the way the creators of this game intended. 

(To be fair, Mystery Dude's story actually turned out to be a bit of a page turner dovetailing neatly back into the other four stories, with the dark humor - or tragic angst if that's how you read it - hitting its apogee, and it actually improved my overall impression of the whole as an actual game rather than a five car pile-up. Mileage may vary, however. Definitely get this one on sale, if you can.)

32582806.review:
TL;DR: Abusive boyfriend simulator. 

STORY ISSUES: I haven't fully played the game in about a year, but [spoiler] as far as I remember, most if not all of the possible boys to date lay their hands on the MC in anger at some point in the story lines. Some of them even outright kill the MC, depending on how much she tolerates abuse.[/spoiler] As others have said the MC is VERY passive, and disturbingly calm about the men in her life man-handling her and even [spoiler] threatening/implying they might r@pe her [/spoiler] at various points in the playthrough. [spoiler] One character even impirsions the MC in a dog cage for a length of time. And no, it's not kinky. Just scary. [/spoiler] The last, unlockable route is definetly the best in the game, but it still has its problems, and that's if you can get through all of the dialouge. And hoo boy, there is [i] a lot of it.[/i] It feels like The first or second draft, because a lot of the chatter you get from Orion is extremely redundant. This kid never shuts up, at all. I enjoy visual novels and paperback novels alike, but there is  only so much redundancy I can tolerate before I start skimming or turning on the skip button.

PRODUCTION VALUES: Top notch. Beautiful graphics, lovely music, talented voice actors (it's all in Japanese though, no English dubbing). It's a shame the people behind these elements of the game didn't find something with a better story to work on. 

GAMEPLAY: Very little actual choices to be made here, sadly. And when you do get choices, a lot of times they either don't actually matter, are trial and error, or just don't make sense. I remember at least one choice is you can pick between something along the lines of "..." OR "....." Brilliant. 


In closing, unless you're looking for something to read while looking at pretty graphics and you don't mind reading about a horrificly dull and boring girl getting abused at every step, I'd look elsewhere for a dating sim or VN. [spoiler] And to be perfectly honest, as someone who has been in a less than ideal friend/partnership, some of the things Toma says in paticular are almost word for word what were said to me by this person. Very, very creepy, and not in a good way.[/spoiler[]

32292652.review:
Wer etwas romantisches Spielen möchte dem ist dieses Spiel ehr weniger zu empfehlen. Ich fand einige Dinge ehr gruselig bis verstörend. 
Die fünf Geschichten behandeln fünf unterschiedliche Männer - der Spieler selbst schlüpft in die Rolle einer Frau, welche ihr Gedächtnis verloren hat und im Laufe der Geschichten beeinflussen kann, wie sich das Verhältnis zwischen ihr und den Männern entwickelt.   Die Heldin kann nur bedingt Entscheidungen treffen und öfter wollte ich sie am liebsten packen und schütteln, weil sie immer so devot ist und alle Abarten verzeiht. ( Spoiler : Es kann passieren das die Heldin „als Puppe“ in einem Käfig leben muss und mit Kuscheltieren und Geschenken überhäuft wird und danach evt Ihrem Peiniger all das verzeiht um ein Happy End zu haben.) Ich als Frau fand es schade das der Charakter nicht klarer Stellung beziehen kann und auch das nicht mehr Charaktere dabei waren die die Heldin wirklich glücklich machen konnten. Wenn uns das Spiel was sagen sollte dann so etwas wie : Frauen sollten das Haus nicht verlassen. Überall ist Gefahr und auch die Menschen die ihr liebt dürfen euch behandeln wie sie wollen…Aber die Heldin selbst muss sich immer selbstaufgeben um den Wünschen anderer zu entsprechen.
Fast alle Charaktere sind sehr speziell und ich frage mich ehrlich wie es sein kann, dass der Charakter um ein Happy End zu bekommen so vieles verdrängt. Man kann schön mitleiden mit der Heldin romantisch ist sehr wenig was sie erleiden kann.  Gerade die Bad Ends und okay auch einige gute Enden sind nicht das was ich mir unter einem Happy End vorstelle. Also romantisch ist ganze ehr weniger. Mord , Totschlag Mobbing und Psychische Krankheiten sind genau Teil des Spieles und das hat mich persönlich doch sehr überrascht. Spannend ist das Spiel aber die Beschreibung  romantisch war für mich irreführend.

31880805.review:
So jetzt muss ich hier auch  mal meinen ersten Kommentar schreiben. Ich war zu beginn recht kritisch ob ich mir dieses Spiel holen soll, da ich noch nie ein otome/visual novel gespielt habe. Und da ich keinen sale oder so was erwischt habe, war es ja auch ne ganze menge Geld.... aber im Nachhinein bin ich froh es getan zu haben. Ich habe das Spiel jetzt einmal komplett durch, oder sagen wir besser ich habe für alle Charaktere das bestmögliche Ende erspielt. Da ich noch kein schlechtes oder normales Ende gesehen habe kann ich darüber jetzt nichts sagen, aber was ich an enden kenne gefällt mir sehr. Aber gehen wir der Reihe nach. 

Zuerst mal der Zeichenstiel: der hat mir wirklich sehr gefallen. Die Hintergründe waren einfach, aber gut, die Charaktere dafür umso besser, unterschiedliches aussehen, viele verschiedene Körperhaltungen, kurz um: sehr schön anzusehen.

Stimmen: also das ist etwas, das ich, als jemand der von solchen spielen bis dato keine Ahnung hatte, nicht erwartet hatte... alle Charaktere haben ihren Text auf japanisch gesprochen, was mir wirklich sehr gefallen hat. Die männlichen Stimmen wahren...naja wie soll ich sagen...“lecker“...kann man das so sagen? Ich denke mal das passt so ;)

dann zur Musik: die Hintergrundmusik war simpel aber schön. Die meiste zeit war es die selbe, was aber nicht gestört hat. Je nach Situation und darin vorhandenen Gefühlen veränderte sie sich und unterstreicht das Gesamtbild perfekt. Die Musik war nie störend oder wirkte deplatziert, ebenso war sie nie langweilig.

Kommen wir zu einem sehr interessanten Punkt, der Vielfalt: 
A) wie gesagt, ich hab vorher nie so ein Spiel gehabt, meine üblichen spielen entsprechen eher OpenWorld, sandbox, survival, fantasy und RPG, weshalb ich mit keinen großen Erwartungen an Handlungsfreiheit oder spielerische Vielfalt/Freiheit an das hier herangegangen bin. Wie erwartet hat man nur sehr eingeschenkte Möglichkeiten. Aber: nur wenn man auf ein bestimmtes Ende hinarbeitet. Ich hatte von Anfang an zum Ziel alle Welten beim ersten Anlauf mit dem bestmöglichen Ende abzuschließen. Und dementsprechend habe ich auch meine Antworten gewählt. Tut man das allerdings nicht, gibt es eine doch recht hohe Vielfalt was die Entwicklung und deine Beziehung zu dem jeweiligen Hauptcharakter angeht. Nebencharaktere kann man jedoch kaum beeinflussen. Jedoch alles in allen mehr und besser als ich erwartet habe, es gab durchaus Momente in denen ich sehr genau bzw lange überlegen musste welche Antwort „richtig“ ist.
B) die Vielfalt der Charaktere/Geschichten ist ausgewogen. Prinzipiell hat man hier folgende Geschichten zu erleben: Kindheitsfreund wird zum geliebten, Mädchen angelt sich Idol, bzw beliebtesten Typen der Stadt, Mädchen erobert unnarrbarens Mathe -genie bzw rationalisten, Kindheitsfreund wird zum geliebten Version 2, und schließlich die Tragödie mit dem „Seelenverwandten“... klingt erstmals nach nichts besonderem, allem schon dagewesenem, und so ist es auch. Aber trotz allem wurden die einzelnen Charaktere und Situationen extrem gut umgesetzt, so dass keine der Geschichten langweilig oder (auf unangenehme weise) vorhersehbar war. Tatsächlich gab es viele Stellen die mich sehr positiv überrascht haben, hauptsächlich in Form von lustigen Momenten. Die zu erobernden Jungs hatten alle sehr schöne, verschiedene Eigenschaften und erstaunlich genaue Hintergrundgeschichten. Interessant war auch wie sie sich in den einzelnen Welten unterschieden haben und was an ihnen immer gleich geblieben ist.

Allgemeines: die vorhandenen Minispiele (nur außerhalb der Story zu spielen) sind eine nette Idee und Ergänzung, wären aber nicht unbedingt nötig gewesen. Die Sammlung der Bilder, Enden und sonstigem finde ich sehr schön und sind auch ein guter Ansporn für verpasste nochmal anzufangen. Die Möglichkeit im Spiel Dialoge zurückzuscrollen ist praktisch und die Statistik, auch wenn ich sie wenig benutzt habe, scheint mir eine gute Hilfe um alle Enden zu erreichen.

FAZIT: ein schönes Spiel das mir eine gute Abwechslung zu meinen sonstigen war und meine Erwartungen übertroffen hat. Allen die noch zweifeln kann ich dieses Spiel wärmstes empfehlen.

31875657.review:
I don't have any complaints about this game*.  If you're familiar with romantic Japanese visual novel games that are targeted towards young women, and have the right expectations, you won't be disappointed.  For example, don't expect anything R-rated.  Sexy options are not allowed.  You can't hit on your own gender.  You can't play as a strong independent woman who don't need no man.  etc...

The art and sound (all voice acting is Japanese) are great.  The stories are good (again, your mileage may vary, but if you like Japanese anime/games you'll probably be fine with this).  The game mechanics are good too (it's not explained very well, but keyboard V is autoplay and keyboard S is skip previously read dialogue, very useful if you want to sit back and relax or collect all the endings, respectively.)

The best compliment I can give this game is that my straight husband watched some of it and was interested enough to play all the routes.  The story is strong enough to make the game enjoyable for anyone (interested in romance visual novels from Japan).

-

* I do have one complaint, and it's a bit of a spoiler, but some of the bad endings are very sudden, and very bad.  There will be mood whiplash, and it will ruin your day.

31461965.review:
I believe this is a fine addition to any otome game fan's collection, and would go as far as to say that it's worth a try even if you aren't a fan. Amnesia: Memories was my very first otome game and I must say I was positively surprised by the experience! Based on this experience I would give a try to the developer's other visual novels. 

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ You can adjust the game window size with your mouse
+ High quality art with lots of variations in CGs
+ Talented voice work through and through 
+ Has a log of said text from the route you are playing
+ Skipping read text works flawlessly 
+ Parameters indicator makes it easier to determine where you stand in relationship

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Background art doesn't fit in with the character art 
- Heroine's art is bland and expressionless
- Lip sync could be better


[b]Final verdict:[/b] ☆☆★★★★★★★★ 
8/10 – Good 
This visual novel is expertly crafted with consistently good artwork, simple music, and talented voice work.  The writing is decent majority of the time; there are some hiccups with it but I would go as far as to forgive the VN for those as it can be enjoyed even despite said hiccups. The length feels appropriate as well. Overall I have a positive opinion of the VN and so my negative points about this game are nitpicks more than anything.

In addition to those I've mentioned above, there's something that is a personal con for me – this VN allows you to name your protagonist. It's just a matter of preferences and thus I didn't include it on the list above, but I still have to note that being able to choose a name in games that have full voice acting just seems weird choice regarless; it results in some awkward moments when the characters are supposed to be saying the protagonist's name. 

The premise for the story – a heroine suffering from amnesia – is undoubtedly a cliché, but it's a cliché that works because of how it was presented. It was interesting that in this VN your companion was set based on the world you chose to enter rather than your choices in interacting with all of them. This made it much more rewarding to replay the game because every character's world/route was distinctive and altogether a new experience. If you are looking at the selection of dateable characters and already have someone in mind, then I recommend looking up which one belongs to which world. 

I've never researched a visual novel to determine choices or routes before playing it. I'm the type who likes to first play it by hand, picking choices that would be closest to ones I'd pick in real life rather than with the intention of reaching a good ending. That tactic usually brings some interesting results and this VN was no exception. I'm going to talk about the worlds/characters in the order I cleared them. Vague spoilers will follow!

[b]Toma:[/b] Ending I got first: BAD [spoiler](We’ll be together forever (Toma-centric))[/spoiler]
I ended up on his route by pure accident, but was pleased since he looked like an interesting character. However, I very quickly begun to have a different vibe from him, downright menacing from the way he acted and talked. It really doesn't help that he never seems sure what he feels, and even his good ending isn't all that good for anyone involved – himself included. If this visual novel had you end up with a partner based on your decisions, then I'd whole-heartedly expect him to be the representative of a bad ending. I think Toma and his good route could have been really, really interesting if the writing had been handled differently. His good route is where the writing of this game really limped around, but I suppose there's still some appeal in it regardless. 

[b]Kent:[/b] Ending I got first: NORMAL [spoiler](I want to see you)[/spoiler]
I found Kent to be really interesting character because of his apparent level-headedness, stoic demeanor, and general attitude. The writing worked well in all of his routes and kept him in character; it really did feel like your choices as a player were the only things affecting the ending as Kent seemed to be reacting accordingly to everything you did. The Kent related bad ending wasn't bad because of Kent and he did nothing wrong in that, while the Ukyo related bad ending wasn't his fault either. I personally found the Normal ending to be the best one, because it was the most realistic and not as syrup sweet as the Good ending.

[b]Ikki:[/b] Ending I got first: BAD [spoiler](I wanted us to live together)[/spoiler]
This was by far the most tedious route to play and I was already fed up with Ikki during the first week with him. I tried to see what his appeal would be but failed to find any, and thus getting a bad ending didn't come as a surprise. The humorous part was that the bad ending I landed on seemed like a good ending for the protagonist! However, the writing for Ikki's routes was decent and consistent with his character no matter which ending you landed on so I have commend the world for that reason. In addition some of the writing of the supporting characters was very entertaining!

[b]Shin:[/b] Ending I got first: NORMAL [spoiler](I will steal you away)[/spoiler]
I was rather looking forward to his world after his appearances in the other worlds had made Shin seem like a fun character. His route was more of a mystery solving adventure than romantic one, which was a strange choice compared to the previous ones. Writing was consistent but the route brought no surprises, so in that regard you might consider it somewhat of a failure. The good ending in this world was the most realistic one of all worlds. 

[b]Ukyo:[/b] Ending I got first: BAD [spoiler](Can you take tomorrow off work?)[/spoiler]
Admittedly I was highly skeptical when starting this, because of his appearances in other characters worlds. However I quickly found myself intrigued by Ukyo's personality and wanted to find out what his deal was. While the big reveal about him wasn't surprising, I still found it to be written decently and have to consider the good ending from his world as the true ending for the visual novel. 

In conclusion, when only looking at the writing of each world and their routes (and ignoring my personal bias for characters) I'd say that the best to worst written worlds are as follows:
Kent → Ukyo → Ikki → Shin → Toma

31454085.review:
The most high-quality, well-produced visual novel I've ever played. Art is gorgeous, music is good, and writing/voice-acting is good. I see some people complaining that the MC is bland but in visual novels, I can accept an essentially-silent protagonist because it allows for the player to embody a character with no preset personality or automatic reactions outside of our control. I enjoyed the game and its production value a lot.

That being said, this is also the most f***ed up visual novel I've ever played. This is not your typical sweet Tokimeki type ish where you go to high school, meet a boy, and raise your stats high enough to get him to date you. Stuff goes OFF THE RAILS in this game. Like it's INCREDIBLY dark. But again, that didn't stop me from enjoying it. Just a warning to anyone who goes into it with those expectations...

Bonus points: each "path" is incredibly different and divergent from the others (they're all essentially totally different stories/universes, with every character being a totally different person in each path/timeline). Fun stuff!

31405353.review:
I was skeptical at the beginning, but I devoured A:M in three days and about 23 hours total of read time. While I recommend it, I don't have any strong feelings about A:M which was enjoyable, but felt superficial to me despite the length.

The voice acting is stellar and a pleasure to listen to. The OST is nice and I only muted it in the last routes, when I wanted to listen to my own music.
The CGs are beautiful and many have additional voicelines that can be triggered in the album by clicking over them. A nice touch!
The character design is... questionable. Almost everybody looks like a fashion monster, with Kent and his belt covered arm as worst offender in my book. The male characters suffer from abnormally elongated limbs and yaoi hands, with their noodle fingers being really distracting.
The backgrounds look like photos heavily filtered. While consistent, they are generic, dull and look lazy, and the only reason I'm mentioning them is that this is not your average indie VN, this is an Otomate product.

The personalities and general relationships among the characters stay the same across all routes, but the plot is vastly different. Completing the first 4 available routes opens up a 5th in which the overarching plot is explained.
MC deserves a couple of lines. She is so pretty! Her design made me really happy... and yet. She loses, on top of her memories, her personality as well. Orion serves as main narrator, and while he is cute and funny, it makes me seriously wonder what the fuck do these guys find in someone who stays silent for 95% of the time and only asks questions. She was so not present that most of the game is either a Orion monologue or a love interest monologue. 
The bad endings are many and extremely easy to meet. You definitely need guides for good and normal routes. Choices matter and there are a lot, yet the system is so intricated that following a guide takes out the fun of actually choosing.
A short description of the guys and my feels about their routes (I hid the most spoilery bits just in case):
[list][*]Shin is blunt, protective of MC and could be defined a light tsundere. His route deals mostly with mystery solving. I found him one of the most positive characters overall. His route was interesting, and his personality and care for MC's wellbeing is consistent in all routes. With that said, his bluntness is quick to become verbal abuse. If MC had a personality she could have snapped back, but she drank up his insults like water. My favorite overall.
[*]Ikki's cheeerful flirtatiousness is caused by his eyes, which have the power to seduce everyone who looks into them. He has a fan club of obsessed girls that serve as antagonist in almost all routes. His aphrodisiac eyes don't work on MC, of course. While he's pretty cute, he's also indecisive and so starved for praise that he enables the fan club's toxicity. His friendship with Kent is amusing, but I found his character shallow and pretty stupid [spoiler](the three months rule smh)[/spoiler].
[*]Kent is often regarded as the game's teddy bear, but I couldn't stand him. He's overanalytic, academically dissects cost/benefit of every action and is socially oblivious. While he mellows out, I found him frustrating and painful to read because of such extreme characterization. [spoiler]No, I do not think that delaying your achievements to go visit the girl you've been dating for 1 month is romantic. I also do not think that talking about marriage after said month is cute. But I'm a disillusioned adult™.[/spoiler]
[*]Toma is the overprotective childhood friend who decided to take on the role of the big brother. He's also a pretty mellow yandere. Many consider his route shocking, and I was promised extremes such as what Harada/Paraiso writes... yet in the end he's a goody two shoes. [spoiler]When he mentioned the harrassment being his own doing, I was actually impressed. I was hoping it would be true. Instead, he just wanted to protect MC from the real threat of the fan club, had good intentions and was actually working to frame the fan club all along (in his twisted way). It made me feel very meh regarding the good ending, and I actually liked his bad ending more. The CG reminds me of DMMd Clear's bad end, in all its tragic, perverted glory.[/spoiler]
[*]Once you unlock all the good endings for the first 4 guys, you can select [spoiler]Ukyo[/spoiler], which popped up in all the other routes. Based on his previous appearances and his vague dialogue, I had already guessed that he was [spoiler]a discount Homura from MadoMagica[/spoiler]. His route was a maze to navigate, but paradoxically the one in which MC had most agency and personality gain (despite the utterly stupid choices and poor tastes). Again, I felt meh about him, and can't really understand his appeal [spoiler](Toma at least had the whole yandere thing going on, but with Ukyo it's straight murder)[/spoiler]. He goes from protective, caring yet torn by [spoiler]the distance he needs to keep[/spoiler] to [spoiler]serial killer[/spoiler] whenever the plot needs him to.
[*]The supporting cast deserves a shoutout. Orion is a nice narrator; Sawa is a undeveloped but loyal friend; despite her rivalry with MC, Mine has mini redemption-arcs that make me like her; the manager has the most drastic personality changes and it becomes pretty funny; Rika is generally meh but gets bearable in the fifth route.
[/list]
I expected more from this apparently dark and twisted otome, but I guess the MC's amnesia and loss of personality limit how far things go. Maybe I'm too hooked on smut mobage ports, but the lack of intimacy irked me. They're in college ffs, yet we only have hugs, kisses... and a marriage proposal after those. Yeah, right. It's a PEGI 12 so I shouldn't have expected much, but again it feels like a missed opportunity to really explore the full potential of the characters.
I might have sounded overly negative, but I'm just disappointed in the wasted possibilities. It's a good otome and a good VN overall, but MC really limited my enjoyement of it and made many situations, especially the romances, unbelievable. 31351687.review:
I always like playing an otome where the general story is different in each path, and I was not disappointed with Amnesia: Memories on this aspect. Beware of marked and unmarked spoilers ahead.

First, I want to talk about the guys and Orion, starting with Orion and Toma. Orion could be incredibly overbearing at times. Ultimately, I like Orion. He obviously cares about the player and even though he doesn't shut up and is at lest 50% of why everyone in the game thinks you are weird, he's nice. Downside, in his desire to protect her, he's kinda paranoid. At least, outside Toma's route where he's weirdly supportive of Toma for most of it, where the other four he distrusts for most of the game. This is probably because around the time he starts to trust the other guys in their storylines, [spoiler]he stops trusting Toma in his because he's been drugging you[/spoiler]. Toma's route was the least interesting one, I think, due to [spoiler]Toma being a rather weak yandere. I hesitate to say he's a badly written yandere, but I would call him a mild or weak yandere. He's more stable and sane than the typical yandere, likely to make him seem more normal and keep in with his friendly attitude, but the effect doesn't really work. You can see they CAN write yandere characters, because Ikki's fangirls contain a lot of yanderes, namely Rika in Ikki's route[/spoiler]. I will say, though, his route calls for trigger warnings, so be cautious. Toma also has a unique metre that I feel Shin and Ukyo could have used, but meh.

Kent is slightly possessive and unsure of his emotions (he actually reminds me a little of Axel from OZMAFIA! in that he's slightly robotic about emotions and possessive). He's calm, cool, collected, and kind of a dork? Kent's idea of an apology present is a maths workbook he made for me and I found that to be ridiculously adorable even though I don't like maths and I think that was when I decided that yeah, he was a keeper.

Ikki is actually enjoyable once you get past the initial few days (I actually started his route first because I wasn't paying attention to the opening video and missed the cues that said who was what route. I was actually aiming for Kent's route first, I'm a fan of glasses characters, and started Ikki's by accident. I would have done it if not for his saying I can "wait as long as I need to" for him on that first day). Once you get past that, he's actually pretty darling, and I'm usually averse to the flirty guys. He's also the only one I got a bad end for. I got it on purpose, though.

Shin is actually pretty fun and I took to him pretty fast even though he comes off as kind of a jerk because it's clear his comments come from a good place. His I did third and it really threw me for a loop because I just wasn't expecting [spoiler]an Ace Attorney-esque attempted murder investigation. I really was reminded of Ace Attorney Investigations[/spoiler]. Shin I think might have the most deep feelings for the heroine, and I love the sheer trust he has in her and that she has in him. I can see why he's the mascot guy. Shin treats his feelings very matter-of-fact, which helps sell the bit.

Ukyo is an absolute sweetheart once you are on his route most of the time and like Shin, his kind of has a mystery going. His ending made me cry because I'm a sucker for stuff like that. Ukyo isn't my favourite of the guys, but I do like him a great deal. His feelings are the strongest, I think, compared to Shin's running the deepest. Ukyo seems to feel the need to prove it more than Shin and goes to great lengths for that happy ending. Also it's crazy easy to get a bad end in his route.

The other characters- the Heroine, Mine, Waka, Rika, and Sawa- are pretty fun. Mine is your frenemy and she's actually kind of fun, Sawa reminds me of my IRL best friend and I thought she was Axel's sister at first because they dress alike, Waka's personality changes depending on the route and this is hilarious to me (especially on Ikki's route. Say it with me: "the customer is the enemy!"), and Rika is... well, the game says she's weird and I can't disagree with that. Also she tried to kill me dead once so I was paranoid around her in Ukyo's route. The Heroine is just an idiot sometimes, or all the time in Toma's route.

Having cleared the game('s good endings), I do kinda wonder [spoiler]why they even have a "Suspicion" metre if three of the five guys are gonna figure it out before Day 3. Kent figures it out midway through the month and Ikki has to be outright told near the end of the month, but Ukyo figures it out after one dialogue tree, Toma by the end of the first day, and Shin by the morning of Day 2, regardless of your choices[/spoiler]. Seems useless outside the first two routes I did.

Overall, the gameplay is fun. I really like the stories, I like the characters, the voices are fitting, I was never bored playing it, the art is gorgeous. Also speaking of, I've never played Persona but the art style and layouts remind me a lot of what I've seen of Persona. Which for all I know, the same people made it but I don't know. The only real issue I come away with is most of Toma's arc. I did come in not knowing that [spoiler]he's supposed to be a yandere, though, so I was surprised by it[/spoiler]. So sure, yeah, I can recommend this game. I had a lot of fun playing it and each storyline was interesting in its own way, Toma's included. There's five long and unique routes for you to play with lots of endings(mostly bad, but there are Normal and Good ones). Oh, and minigames.

Speaking of the minigames, I wouldn't recommend using a trackpad or a touchscreen with them, the game nopes into oblivion and you lose. Get a mouse and use it.

31130161.review:
Engaing, funny, full-voiced and with beautiful CG’s, this is without a doubt a top notch Otome visual novel game. 
And yet… 
Why is it that I couldn’t fully connect? 
Why did I find SoulsSet – an indie and very underrated game – so much more interesting and engaging than this oh so talked about game? 
I’m not sure. 
Maybe there wasn’t enough of a mystery for me? 
Maybe it's because I watched the anime first? 
Despite that, it’s obvious I enjoyed Amnesia Memories and would recommend it to every Otome lover out there. 
It’s way too beautiful to pass on, let me tell you that. 
I’m still swooning all over the design of this game. 
And the full-voiced thing is simply divine. 
Not to mention, the story is rich, your choices matter (boy, do they matter) and each route has multiple endings. 
I played it from beginning to end and can honestly say you're in for some good times.

Now that we got my personal opinion out of the way, let's move into the technical stuff, shall we? ;)

Our protagonist - *insert name here* (I called her Aqua) - wakes up to find her memories missing. In their stead, there's a spirit named Orion. Apparently, for reasons unknown, Orion has crashed into the mind of our protagonist and caused her to lose her memories. Now, n order to get them back and return to normal life ASAP, our protagonist - with Orion's much-needed help - must reclaim them herself all the while hiding it from the people around her. With her memories gone, who can she trust? 

As always, I would highly recommend playing each route at least once on your own before turning to walkthroughs. 
I used this one (https://otomedreamworld.wordpress.com/?s=amnesia+memories). Without a doubt the best I found. 

The characters - 

Orion: 
Orion doesn't have a route, as he is your ever so cheerful and ever so hilarious spirit guide.
Just think of him as your best friend and the voice of reason. He'll always be on your side and will always do his best to help you out. Orion is a true friend during the tough times to come. 

Shin: 
Shin is your childhood friend turned boyfriend. 
He may be harsh at times - who am I kidding, pretty much all the time - but underneath it all there's a heart that beats just for you. 
Personally speaking, Shin is my first favorite turned the second favorite (Sorry, Shin! I love you but I couldn't resist Ukyo once I reached his route). 

Ikki: 
Ikki is a true contradiction. 
Prepare yourself for some major confusion and frustration. 
But if you play your cards right, you'll find out what's really going on under all of the pretend. 
Just beware of the girls. 

Kent: 
You may want to punch Kent in the face more often than not but restrain yourselves and you won't regret it. 
Kent may seem like a heartless genius, but it's only what there is on the surface. You don't have to wait too long to see that. 

Toma: 
Ah, Toma. 
Ever so protective "big brother" Toma. 
I shall say no more about him since the rest should come as a complete and utter surprise (mixed with shock). 

Ukyo: 
.... 
You can only play Ukyo's route after getting all of the other characters good endings. 
Think of Ukyo as the last boss. 
Every question still left unanswered... you'll get on his route. 

And that's pretty much it. 
Don't forget to play the mini games and the memories after completing each route for some more fun times. 
And when you complete it all, you'll also unlock some extras to read. 

Trust your gut, follow Orion, and find our the truth. 
After that... 
Good luck!

31109894.review:
This is one of my favorite visual novels.

I was really stunned, how good this game is, although it's so old (for a vn). The story is great, the pacing is really good and the music also fits very well.

The story, although it's [spoiler] about amnesia [/spoiler] is very well done. The main isn't that stupid or helpless and she isn't a damsel in distress, but tries to do her best in her own way. I really like her. She also doesn't try to seduce the guys, but tries to be not a burden to them. It's more about love than romance - she tries to find [spoiler] her own memories, while falling in love with the guys, who are kind to her[/spoiler]. Also it has something like redemption as a theme too [spoiler] e.g. in Shin's route, when Touma explains that he tried to kill her... or when the MC realizes that Kent really loves her and she was just awful to him without a real "reason" [/spoiler] 

The art is rather okay, but you can't expect it to be as well as in the recent games. BTW Amnesia has sequels, but they aren't translated in english. But in those you can see, how the art improved.

About the stories itself: There were good one's and there were not that good ones. My favorite is Touma, although [spoiler] he is a yandere, who drugs you, kills you a few times and locks you in a cage, if you don't pay attention.[/spoiler] But Touma is also [spoiler] a really sweet guy. He is the one, who knows that you have amnesia from the beginning, and I SWEAR IF THAT DOESN'T MEAN THAT HE LOVES YOU A LOT THAN I DON'T KNOW OK [/spoiler]
Aside from trying to explain my liking to him, there are also Kent's and [spoiler] Ukyo's [/spoiler] stories that are great.
Ikki's story was okay-ish, but maybe it's because I don't like this type of guys...
Shin's story wasn't that good though, so I'd start with him. His personality wasn't really ... well, he is slightly annoying and I don't like him. He's a jerk most of the time... a very cold jerk.

Anyway, a fair warning: Most likely you will play through the whole game after buying it... And you won't sleep or do anything else before finishing it. 

SUMMARY:
There is a great story, great characters and great music
The pacing is awesome
You don't want to stop playing after buying it
The order I'd recommend:
Shin -> Ikki -> Kent -> Touma -> [spoiler] Ukyo [/spoiler]
The main character is REALLY AMAZING 
-> I don't know many vn, where the main isn't annoying or a damsel in distress...
The art is also very nice

==> Buy it. Play it. And you will like it, if you like visual novel. I really think you will <==

[b]Amnesia™: Memories[/b]

[b]Synopsis:[/b]

You awaken to find your memories gone. To learn the truth behind your amnesia, you’ll choose from five romantic paths, each its own world. With 20+ endings, can you write the lasting love story you deserve, or will your love and life come to an end?

- Voice Included

[b]Music[/b] - 9/10
[b]Graphics[/b] - 10/10
[b]Contents[/b] - 10/10
[b]Gameplay[/b] - 9/10


[b]Final Opinion:[/b]

This was in fact the first Visual Novel that I played and loved, not only for the quality of the drawing itself but for the story. Each story is unique and holds the screen who plays. If they have never played a Visual Novel you should play this to start and you will not regret it. Let's say it's an interactive anime with the player.

So I do recommend it.


[b]Note:[/b] 9/10

The artwork and voice acting are very good.  I really liked the character designs but I was also a rabid VK fan.  Unfortunately the MC is very bland and her style does not mesh with the rest of the cast.  I enjoyed a few of the routes.  Some of it's pretty boring but sweet, and then the game goes totally off-the-walls.  What annoyed me is how much of a freaking doormat the MC is-- I know that's the norm in otome games but this was ridiculous.  Her life is in danger and all she can say is "I still love you~  uwu~" Like c'mon, at least run away you idiot.  She's missing her memories because she was lobotomized, obviously.

It's a decent VN with good graphics, good voice acting, fun extras and um.... [u]unique[/u] storylines.  Definitely wait for it to go on sale on Steam before you buy it at full price.  I only paid $6.59CDN for it during one of Steam's big sales.

Be forewarned though, some of the content is pretty effed up.  I think I have PTSD from this game.  There is a lot of abuse towards the MC in some of the routes (psychological, physical, emotional) and a bit of sexual coercion.  If those things bother you, then I wouldn't recommend this game to you.

Aside from that, it's fun and pretty and worth the time.

30756648.review:
[h1][b] For the full review, feel free to check it out here: https://visualnovelreviews.com/2017/03/25/amnesia-memories-review/ [/b][/h1]

[b]STORYLINE 4/5[/b]

Pros: 
[list]
[*] Refreshing and different in comparison to other otome games
[*] Immersive game experience
[*] Complex plot 
[*] Routes are inherently different; there are unique and different storylines throughout every playthrough (no common route)
[*] Every route is a missing piece of the puzzle for the player to put together, and paints the picture for the overarching storyline. 
[*] The pieces of the puzzle culminate to the true ending/canon route of the game
[/list]

Cons: 
[list]
[*] Uses parameters and can be difficult to balance on first play through
[*] Easy to end up on the bad endings without a walk through
[*] True ending and certain storyline explanations could have been fleshed out much better
[/list] 

[b]CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT 4/5[/b]

Pros:
[list]
[*] Interesting cast line up with unique personalities
[*] 5 seperate bachelor routes to choose from
[*] Each character route has a completely different take on the storyline, creating a refreshing game experience
[*] Character roles and relationships change in every route 
[*] Although the heroine has a very bland personality initially due to her amnesia, as you advance in the game and regain her memories; her real personality slowly returns.
[*] The heroine herself is a puzzle for the player to solve.
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*] Some routes are written a lot better than others, and not all up to the same standard of quality
[*] Has some very dark and twisted characters (not for everyone)
[/list]

[b]DESIGN 5/5[/b]

Pros:
[list]
[*] Beautiful art, you will not be disappointed
[*] Expansive art gallery and amazing assortment of CGs for every character
[*] Great resolution/HQ even on the steam platform port (originally a PSVita release)
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*] Character outfit designs are a little strange, and not to everyone's taste. You get used to it as you continue to play the game. 
[/list]

[b]MUSIC AND VOICE ACTING 5/5[/b]

Pros:
[list]
[*] Soothing and lovely; suits the mood and tone of the game perfectly.
[*] Same composer (Manyo) for the Kara no Shoujo series
[*] Famous and veteran voice acting cast; emulated their character personalities perfectly. 
[*] For example: Kent (VA: Akira Ishida 石田 彰 – Naruto series as Gaara, Danganronpa series as Byakuya Togami)
[*] Shin (VA: Tetsuya Kakihara 柿原 徹也- Code Realize ~Guardian of Rebirth~ as Viktor Frankenstein)
[*] Toma (VA: Satoshi Hino 日野 聡 – Naruto series as Sai, The Disastrous Life of Saiki K as Kineshi Hairo).
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*] None
[/list]

[b] SYSTEM 5/5[/b]
[list]
[*] Easy to navigate and use
[*] Great UI 
[*] Incudes CG Gallery, music record list, short stories and extra content post-game 
[*] Scene recollection
[*] Mini-games (challenge your favourite bachelor to games such as rock/scissors/paper and air hockey) 
[*] Phone system that helps progress the storyline (receive texts and calls from characters)
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*] None
[/list]

[b]CONCLUSION[/b]
[list]
[*] Great game
[*] Be on the look out for steam sales (regularly goes on sale for -90% off $2.99 USD). This sale is insane; you won't find another Visual Novel of this quality for that price. 
[*] Heroine is a mystery herself that is solved through progression in the game
[*] Different storyline approach in comparison to the usual otome game format
[*] Mixed feelings on some character routes, but overall all endings were satisfying
[*] Some routes definitely had better writing and character development than others.
[*] Non-linear storyline created a refreshing and immersive experience by putting together the pieces of the overarching plot 
[*] Would like to see other Amnesia games in the series localised
[*] Recommended
[/list]

OVERALL RATING: 4/5

30593557.review:
In Amnesia: Memories, as the title already suggest, you completely lost all your memories and you have to complete 5 paths before resolve the mistery behind your amnesia. Orion, the spirit attached to your soul in this adventure, will help you to collect your memories and guide you in parallel world with different love interests, pacific and dark ends. Which one will you trust? Will you be able to survive until the end?

I really don't know how to describe my feelings about this Otome game. Am I satisfied? Am I not happy with it? 
The only word that come out of my mind is: Meh.

I enjoyed the art style,  voice actors were absolutely perfect, anime's style expressions, but I found the atmosphere kind of flat and lame.
Except when you meet Ukyo during each paths, I have never felt the distress and tense feeling of someone that has lost all her memories. 30573365.review:
Because of the overwhelmingly positive reviews, I thought I'd give this game a try. I like otome games and dating sims, and the art looked great. Unfortunately, I didn't think to check the negative reviews and really wish I had. Reviewers bring up legitimate concerns about the way the game handles abusive relationships that anyone thinking about buying the game should really consider. 

My main complaints are:

1) I know it's a visual novel, but I would've liked more choices in general. I.e., more dialogue/response choices, and the ability to override Orion's mandates (or ANY of the characters' decisions, actually) and make your own decisions about what the MC is going to do. Instead, I felt like a helpless bystander watching the MC be victimized again and again. 

2) The MC is a blank slate but you can't really do anything with that. She is passive and submissive throughout. It would've been so much better if you could actually shape her character (there was so much potential there!). It's really telling that she works at a maid cafe where customers are addressed as "master" and whatnot. That same subservience translates into her personal relationships, apparently. 

3) The MC's lack of characterization is replaced by Orion, who reacts to and reiterates everything; basically, he's telling you how you "should" respond to what's going on. This could've been ok if he provided insight rather than pointing out the immediately obvious, and if you could actually shape the MC's character. 

4) Lastly, though a matter of personal taste, I wish there was more variety in the characters' styles. As in, it'd be ok if one or two characters were punk or whatever they are, but they're ALL part of the Hot Topic clique. Except the MC, oddly enough. 

All that said, I do want to acknowledge that the artwork looks good and the voice acting was good. And some might really like the characters' aesthetic and some or all of the routes, unhealthy as they are IRL. I get that. I just wish we had more options: namely the choice to opt out of or redirect the toxic relationships if we want.

30563866.review:
Hay varias cosas negativas que quiero destacar en primer lugar:
- Uno de los personajes tiene cierta manera de actuar que se romantiza cuando en realidad es muy tóxico y no es algo de lo que enamorarse ni querer.
- El precio. Considero que es carete, así que mejor en unas rebajas (o un regalo, como fue mi caso).
- Que esté únicamente en inglés. Para mí no fue un problema, pero sé que esto tira mucho para atrás.
- Lo único que harás es leer. Lo pongo como punto negativo porque sé que a mucha gente eso no le gusta, y puede llegar a ser un inconveniente para hacerte con juego (desde luego para mí no).

Con todo esto no penséis que no me ha gustado el juego; justo lo contrario: el juego me ha gustado mucho. Tiene una historia interesante e intrigante, sus personajes están bien definidos y te acabarán conquistando. Tiene bastantes finales, y sin seguir guía conseguirlos todos te llevará tus buenas horas, además de los desbloqueables y los logros de Steam. La banda sonora está bastante bien, y los dibujos a mí en especial me encantaron.

Recomendaría este juego a todo aquel que le guste leer, el género otome y que no le importe que esté en inglés (si tienes cierta idea del idioma seguro que no tienes problemas). También recomiendo que os veáis el anime tras pasaros el juego por completo, pues complementa muy bien desde otra perspectiva esta historia.

P.D: Es una historia cerrada, pero ojalá y en un futuro saquen una continuación u otra historia de este estilo.

30287717.review:
I was first drawn to this series after watching the anime on Hulu, and thoroughly enjoyed the story and characters while watching it.  What makes the game even better than the anime however, is the ability to choose how your character reacts to everything around her.  One of my favorite features of this game are the multiple worlds with multiple endings.  After watching the anime series, I knew a few things about the characters, but the dark turns that the game takes are just perfect.  It really shows that everyone has secrets or flaws that they don't show the world, and in my opinion, really helps make them seem more real despite their fantastical appearances.

Overall, I would highly recomend this game to anyone who enjoys visual novels or dating sims, or to someone who is just getting into the genre.  I only hope Steam will port the other games in the series so I can continue my adventures with these amazing characters.  Luckily for me, I managed to grab this game on sale, but it is more than worth the $29.99 price tag and would make a wonderful addition to any game library.

29894312.review:
If you're a tomboy who looks at dating sims and rolls her eyes, I highly reccomend you reconsider. Because I was that tomboy, too. Then I gave this game a try and I was fully surprised at the twists and turns this story took. There's a lot more here than just trying to get your choice of supposedly hot guy, and all the characters have their own distinct personalities. There's even character to the girl you play as, though most of it's still trying to be as directly interactive as it can.

There are surprisingly dark turns in here as well, and one of my favorite features for any video game: multiple endings. I still haven't seen them all. There's also plenty of times to just get different reactions in general from almost any of the characters, main and support, so I can't reccomend this game enough! The only thing I'd say is wait for the right price, cause I lucked out and snagged it when it was 90% off. XD Though for what all you get in this game, I think $30 is just as fair.

29645151.review:
Вас ждёт большое и увлекательное путешествие по параллельным мирам!

Наша героиня переживёт самые разнообразные события, сюжеты, судьбы и встречи. Дорожка неумолимо ведёт девушку к душераздирающему финалу. Истина, которая откроется после прохождения всех вариантов миров, поражает. Это насколько сильно надо любить человека, чтобы на такое пойти!..

1. Линия Икки показалась чересчур слащавой и типично японской (тема фан-клуба, айдола). Однако здесь неплохо обыгрывается тема одиночества, когда ты находишься среди толпы обожающих тебя людей. Любить всех — не любить никого.

2. Ветка Кента порадовала и показала, что можно измениться в лучшую сторону,  если рядом будет любимый человек, оказывающий поддержку.

3. Тома это no comments, парень поехал на теме заботы (классика жанра, на самом деле), не очень понравился рут. 

4. Шин... Это любовь. Парень, который стоит за героиню горой, во всём помогает, по-настоящему заботится, пытается разобраться в случившемся, сам не унывает несмотря на всё деpьмо, да и героиню подбадривает и тискает :) В моём понимании это идеальный мужчина. Мой парень и Шин очень похожи характерами и поступками, поэтому мне было очень приятно проходить рут Шина.

5. Лично меня очень впечатлил рут Укё, обожаю его. Парень столько раз, столько времени страдал, натурально сходя с ума, и тем не менее сделал всё как надо в итоге. Он очень неоднозначная личность и, скорее всего, вызовет у вас целую гамму эмоций и чувств.

I'm trying, but I've gone
Through the glass again.
Just come and find me!
God loves everybody, don't remind me!
I took the medicine and I went missing.
Just let me hear your voice, just let me listen!

All of my thoughts of you
Bullets through rock and through.
Come apart at the seams.
Now I know what dying means.

I am not my rose itself,
Left my roses on my shelf.
Take the wild ones, they're my favorites.
It's the side effects that save us.

Все руты примерно равноценно интересны. Персонажи замечательно проработаны, за их историями одно удовольствие наблюдать, они захватывают и затягивают, не отпускают, пока игра не будет пройдена. Здесь нет бессмысленных сюжетных ходов, всё разжёвывают и объясняют, раскладывают по полочкам.

Игра заставляет задуматься: а на что реальные люди способны пойти ради близких и любимых? Повторили ли бы вы поступки героев Амнезии?..

Озвучка диалогов великолепна, графика и анимация выше всяких похвал, CG-арты очень сочные и красивые. Эта игра прекрасна во всём, не нашла в ней абсолютно никаких недостатков. Очень рекомендую всем любителям визуальных новелл (особенно девушкам).

Когда проходишь такие истории, ничуть не жалеешь о потраченном времени. Они увлекают и дают повод задуматься о многом: о судьбоносных последствиях выбора, человечности, любви и шансах, которые нельзя упускать.

Эта новелла теперь №1 в моём списке любимых визуалок, а прошла я их немало. Если вы любите английский язык и хотите в нём попрактиковаться, то эта игра идеально подойдёт для такой цели. Диалогов много, они все интересные, вы с лёгкостью значительно пополните ваш словарный запас. Кстати, если хотите поиграть во что-то близкое по духу, очень советую корейские новеллы Dandelion и Nameless, они есть в Стиме. 

Я написала издателю и спросила, не хотят ли они сделать русскую локализацию, предложила свою помощь. На данный момент у Idea Factory нет таких планов, хотя они были бы рады её добавить. Также мне ответили, что другие игры вселенной Амнезии пока не планируется добавлять в Стим и локализировать на других языках, но если они получат больше просьб об этом, то могут и подумать ;) Idea Factory очень дружелюбные ребята, пишите им смело (на английском), если хотите высказать какие-то мысли, пожелания, идеи: support@ideafintl.com

29616975.review:
Full disclosure: I am a 21 year old guy, so I realize I'm outside the intended demographic for this game.

Having recently got into visual novels, I bought this game on during the winter sale. I didn't expect much, but I was pleasantly surprised at how engaged I was. While each romance option is a stereotype, I feel they're very well done here. Character tropes are fine as long as the execution is there. My personal favorites are Shin and Kent. The stories for each individual guy are easy to follow and told pretty well. The overarching plot, as explained in Ukyo's route, is a bit confusing, but nothing too egregious (they fucked it up real bad in the anime though). The art is gorgeous, and while the soundtrack as a whole is nothing to write home about, I'm a huge fan of the OP and ED.

As for the topic of unhealthy relationships, I can certainly agree Toma's is fucked as all hell, and shit gets pretty crazy with Ukyo, but other than that... eh? Shin is rough around the edges, Ikki's flirtation is explained by his "condition," and Kent just doesn't understand love. But they all take care of you, never go further than they sense you're comfortable with, and it's established that you were in a relationship with them before hand. OF COURSE they're going to be affectionate until they learn of your amnesia. 

Anyways, that's just my thoughts. Heroine is a terrible character though, I'll give you that. 8/10

Anstatt, wie bei einem Point&Klick-Adventure Dinge wie Schubladen, Betten oder Türen anzuklicken, kommt, in der immergleichen Einstellung, ein Textbaustein mit den Aufschriften "Schubladen", "Bett", "Tür" und dazu Orion, der Spirit, der einen Kommentar dazu abgibt.
Eh?!
Ich liebe Spiele wie "The Night of the Rabbit" oder "Edna bricht aus" und habe erwartet, dass dieses Spiel in eine ähnliche Richtung geht.
Japanische Spiele können große Freude machen, Fire Emblem, Final Fantasy und Street Fighter sind nur ein paar wenige Beispiele. Nichts von deren Kreativität ist da reingeflossen, es wirkt hingeklatscht, kitschig und absolut langweilig.
Bitte nicht kaufen!

29572801.review:
While this game is not your typical romance otome, It is one filled with mystery, murder, and malice.

The charm of this game is that the boys are not perfect, and you unknowing of who they are, what they are like, and what they are going do to through these worlds while this game exhibits very unhealthy relationships in ways that are dark, being that of your significant other, people who hate you, or even a friend. This includes but not limited to; Murdering, kidnapping,  sexual asult. So please keep that in mind while playing this game. Its really stressful and heart wrenching at times, but maybe its like a train wreck, that everyone kinda wants to watch.

Through the game you make choices that lead to many endings, Good, Normal, and Bad endings. Good endings is where everything that happened comes to a good light hearted conclusion, a 360 turn around from the rough story you just went through. Normal ending is pretty much....well normal, it ends well, though you are not in any relationship. Bad endings are those horrid ones, the ones where the screen goes red with the "BAD END" written in black letters.....pretty much, you died, game over, hope you made a save spot because you might want to retry that crap. (Though luckily for those who dont save the game has a skip feature that skips all the reading and even highlights your last choices so you know what you may have chosen wrong) That being said however it must be noted, Guess what! You get achievements for each end! Goody!

The art, story and characters all have real depth, amazingly done! I even had to take pictures of the little slides between days to enjoy the cute scetches of the man of choice! Which brings me to my last point. Least violent characters, and most violent characters. However no matter where on the list you still get abused in ways, hurt, and even murdered.
 here is my personal list on who is least violent to most and some what why. 
[b]Slight spoiler warning if you want this info so you have been warned. [/b]

[olist]

[*] [spoiler]Kent: He is the logical one, kinda just never did relationships. Gets excited for dating just half a month, kinda slow but cute.[/spoiler]

[*][spoiler] Ikki: He opens up as cocky, but turns out to just be looking for love, though you fear him dumping you and his fans are horrid to you. Bitches be crazy.[/spoiler]

[*][spoiler]Shin : Nothing like being called an Idiot every 10 minutes and getting lied to every 5 minutes! This attempt of murder to you is done and you have to find out who done it! Careful![/spoiler]

[*][spoiler] Toma: Nothing like waking up locked away! <3 #relationshipgoals! (oh god please no) My personal least favorite, been through slimier bad relationships, not wanting to let you go anywhere, you cant do this, wear this, but to an extreme. IM NOT YOUR PET TOMA![/spoiler]

[*] [spoiler]Ukyo: Yeah, that is right, by the time you get this you have had to gotten at least one good or normal ending in all the others, and if you haven't gotten the bad ones..... you may be thinking, "Oh him..? No way....he was so sweet and innocent!~" NEVER TRUST THE QUIET ONES!
[/spoiler]


I highly recommend this game if you dont want the normal OTOME experience. This dark mystery will leave you guessing for a while. Just remember, This is not how you want your real relationships people, Normalizing real abuse is not a good thing, things like this happen, well....without all the mythical, magical, demon stuff. Abuse happens, and if you are in an abusive relationship, get help the national abuse hotline is toll free, 24/7 at 1-800-799-SAFE (7233). Otherwise have fun and enjoy this beautiful game!

29306035.review:
[h1]Remember that this is a Japanese visual novel; expect Japanese values, good ends, and bad ends. [/h1]

[b]My TL;DR recommendation is BUY:[/b]
[list]
[*]Great character graphics
[*]Excellent voice acting
[*]Excellent English translation
[*]Interesting plotlines
[/list]
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Category[/th]
        [th]Score[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]Plot[/b][/td]
        [td][b]8/10[/b][/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]Gameplay[/b][/td]
        [td][b]10/10[/b][/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]Graphics[/b][/td]
        [td][b]5/10[/b][/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]Soundtrack[/b][/td]
        [td][b]6/10[/b][/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]Replayability[/b][/td]
        [td][b]8/10[/b][/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][b]Overall[/b][/td]
        [td][b]8/10[/b][/td]
    [/tr]

[/table]

[h1]Plot [8/10][/h1]
You play as an amnesiac college girl; after waking up in a hospital, you can pursue [i]one[/i] love interest per route while meeting the other love interests as friends and colleagues. Each route has different trials and tribulations as you develop your relationship.

[spoiler]Sometimes, the plot can seem a bit forced like awkwardly penned fanfiction, especially in Ikki’s route. I personally found Kent’s route to be the most normal, refreshing, and fulfilling.[/spoiler]

Overall, it’s really enjoyable getting to know all the different characters. By the time I got 100% on the game, I liked (or at least understood) everyone, which is rare. See the Game-Specific Comments for more detail.

[h1]Gameplay [10/10][/h1]
It’s a visual novel with typical choices. It’s a 10 for lack of things to criticize.

[h1]Graphics [5/10][/h1]
While the characters are crisply drawn, unique, and expressive, you have to wonder why they’re walking around wearing punk-rock outfits all the time. You’re a university student; some of the love interests are also students — there’s no way they’re wearing that day-to-day in Japan! Also, in contrast to the abysmal anime of Amnesia, [spoiler]there’s no ballin’ rock band get-together in any of the routes[/spoiler], so the design choice to have [spoiler]Kent[/spoiler], especially, wrapped in a trenchcoat and belts is a strange one. Though the backgrounds are decent enough, they have little detail and become repetitive as you play though the game. This game really wants you to focus on the foreground; the characters and their expressions. The characters are intricate, so mission accomplished.

[h1]Soundtrack [6/10][/h1]
The soundtrack is mostly there just to fill silences. None of the pieces are very memorable during the game, though the title sequence by Zoetrope as well as the theme played at the successful end of the route get honorable mentions. You might get some of the tracks stuck in your head if you play the game for a while, but they aren’t melodies you’ll carry with you after (in contrast to games like Skyrim with songs you’ll probably listen to once you’re done playing).

[h1]Replayability [8/10][/h1]
I read a guide to get all possible endings, including the bad ones. It was fun (and occasionally disturbing) to see all of the outcomes for the heroine. If you fall in love with fictional characters, you’ll enjoy playing through the routes again for [strike]a bishounen fix[/strike] waifu simulation.

[h1]Overall [8/10][/h1]
It’s well-made and one of the better visual novels you can get on Steam. I enjoyed playing it all the way to 100% completion and will probably replay my favourite routes a few times.

[h1]Game-Specific Comments[/h1]
As many other reviewers note, this game tends to portray [b]very unhealthy relationships[/b]. Two of the routes involve the heroine [spoiler]being physically assaulted and being trapped in a cage. No exaggeration. Your boyfriends in those routes have serious mental problems that aren’t really examined or brought to light. And, in [i]another[/i] route, one of those boyfriends becomes the antagonist![/spoiler] Though I personally find two of the love interests to make very unhealthy/distasteful/abusive choices as partners, it may be examined differently in Japanese than Western culture. The remainder of the love interests are fairly human and make normal relationship mistakes. [u]So again, keep in mind that this game was targeted at a female Japanese audience.[/u]

Hope you enjoyed my review of Amnesia: Memories! If you liked it, please upvote. :)

But I put up with it, assuming it was just a culture thing from Japan. Not that I approve of it nor would I put up with it in my own relationship. But okay, it's a game. Whatever. At least it's not abuse...

And then I played the diamond route. 

This game gets super messed up in a really creepy and uncomfortable way. I thought it was just because I was triggering his bad ending, but then upon another (extremely reluctant) playthrough, the events pretty much follow the same lines. It was extremely unsettling the amount of abuse dished upon you that in order to get a good ending, you needed to forgive. I did not want to forgive. That seems like the most volitale destructive relationship I have ever witnessed in media. And all the characters seem to just laugh off Toma's actions at the end as just overprotectiveness. I'm sorry, no? How about hell no? Nothing could be done to forgive what Toma put your character through. Absolutely nothing.

The graphics are beautiful. The stories I've played so far have been engaging and interesting. But I'm gonna say, do not play Toma's story if you are looking for a healthy relationship. You will not find it there. Please do not idolize that relationship in any way. It is extremely unhealthy and sure to end in the MC being murdered someday for looking at another man the wrong way.

29162072.review:
8/10. Bought this game during the Steam Winter sale, and I thought it was worth it. Completed all endings + all achievements thus far.

What I Liked
*I loved the art and the voice acting. (Akira Ishida is one of my favorite seiyuu.)
*I liked the design of the CG gallery and how it allows you to replay the scene and allows you to click on the images for extra voice clips.
*I thought that the backgrounds of the relationships that the heroine had with the capture targets were well thought out; some where rather cliche though. [spoiler]Osananajimi x2.[/spoiler]
*I liked the presence of other characters in a particular capture target's route. [spoiler]"It was as if devil had granted my wish." ...Or Lord Nhil...[/spoiler]
*I enjoyed the mini-games, especially winning at them; I would've liked for them to have been incorporated into the story itself though.
*I loved doing Kent's math puzzles.
*[spoiler]Despite what others say, I thought yandere Toma was cute~[/spoiler]

What I Disliked
*I'm not too big a fan of having a character route locked down so quickly. I'd prefer several choices to be made in order to choose a route. (I was expecting that the heroine would have to raise affection with a particular character first to lock into their route.)
*I would have liked for the heroine to be have been voiced even though she has few lines.
*Additionally, I would have liked for every character to have a sprite even though some some minor. [spoiler]I believe *Kent's mother and Taeko did not have sprites but did have voiced lines. I mainly feel this way because some of Ikki's fanclub members do have sprites.[/spoiler] 
*I wish there was a music room, so the BGM could be replayed on its own.
*I would have liked a harem option. [spoiler]Though I suppose the guys would all get brutally jealous, so maybe it wouldn't work out.[/spoiler]
*I wish there was an Orion route. [spoiler]Though I suppose some of the bad endings are?[/spoiler]
*I wished there were more math puzzles. [spoiler]Especially the more complex one Kent mentioned in his good ending...[/spoiler]
*I felt like some Ukyo could have been fleshed out some more. [spoiler]I don't think the game really got much into why he has such a destructive alternate personality much, other than saying it was due to the distress of dying so many times. My first assumption was that Lord Nhil became corrupted from being with Ukyo for so long, and he was the alternate personality.[/spoiler]

Other Comments
*I read one review complaining about the heroine lacking a personality, but I think it's purposely that way because it's an otome game. The heroine is supposed to be [i]you[/i] after all. It's something of an immersion factor I suppose, so you can pretend that you're truly dating these guys.
*I...didn't know there was an anime...

29123214.review:
I have gotten into Otome Games after playing Amnesia Memories. I have played backstage pass and Blood Code. One thing that makes this game stand apart from the others is the fact YOU DO NOT PLAY THE SAME STORY OVER AND OVER AGAIN WHEN PURSUING THE OTHER CHARACTERS! THIS IS AWESOME! I think this is a huge feature. I know I haven't played a whole lot of Otome games, but I am thinking, based on my experience, that a lot of otome games force you to replay the same story and based on your choices, changes your end story a bit. 

Visually, this story is good (just wish they wore better clothing...yikes!), but overall it is stunning. Amnesia memories is a novel game sort of like a choose your own adventure books you might have read and been familiar with when you were younger. 

The story line is decent too. If you like otome games you will most likely like this game. The basic premise of the story is a girl who had a spirit collide her mind and now has amnesia. She needs to go through the various worlds (where there is a new guy she is supposed to pursue) without letting them know she HAS amnesia. The mystery of the story involves a guy who pops up occasionally. He seems to know more about the heroine than he should and warns the heroine of danger. He either appears that he has genuine concern or is downright creepy - seeming to take pleasure in the idea that the heroine might die. 

There is one path that really depicts an unhealthy relationship with boy Yandere (in the simplistic term...a psychopath) if it was to happen in the real world there is no way I would entertain someone like that...BUT it isn't the real world. Personally, I liked his path, if nothing else than to scare the hell out of me. It made me tread very carefully in all the paths and raised my level of distrust.

In each path you can have a bad ending, normal ending, and good ending. It was fun to see what happened if I responded to the characters naturally. 

The final path wraps the story nicely. It explains the reason Orion (the spirit) collides with her mind and why this guy keeps showing up. 

I guess that is all I can say about it without giving away the story. Its good! I like it. I hope Idea Factory brings out more games including Amnesia Later, Crowd, and World. BUT I also heard they have a few other popular games as well. Most North Americans do not own psp vita in comparison to over there and instead have the consoles or computers. Just don't download illegally. It is annoying and is apparently one of the main sole reasons they are hesitant to introduce these games over here. 

The fact is that these kind of games are new to North Americans. Sorry to say, but has to be said. They are taking a risk introducing these games to which most North Americans are not aware of this genre yet. So, I repeat DO NOT DOWNLOAD ILLEGALLY!.

29106105.review:
7/10

I've read through the spade story enough to get three different endings, but I believe there to be more.  And there are four different characters to pick from, so I can imagine spending 20+ hours if you wanted to read all of the endings for all four characters.  Plus, the dialogue is all voice-acting with English subtitles.  That alone makes it worth the money spent (though I bought it on sale, I did not pay full price for it).  The only gripe I have is how the game calculates your answers to give the endings.  Without revealing too much in the way of spoilers, I read through one story, got all the way up to a love confession/kiss scene, yet immediately after that the story took a downhill turn (without any more input from me) and I ended up with a neutral ending.  The story clearly took a turn based on my immediate choices (the kiss scene), then reached a point of calculation to add up all of my choices to provide me with a neutral ending.  I was quite frustrated since everything after that scene made no sense.  Still, the characters were well-developed and the plot was interesting.  I'm currently in the heart world as my second story choice, and it is a completely different story though the characters are all the same.  The fact that there are four complete and different stories, as well as several different endings to each story makes me give this otome a 7/10.  Definitely better than a lot of other otomes I've read.
