29064262.review:
It's been a while since I played an otome game and this one here really showed me, what I was missing. 

First of all the art is beautiful and sets the mood perfectly. Once in a while I caught myself stopping to read just to look at the pictures that appear once in a while (which you can afterwards find in the gallery :DD) and I really enjoyed everything.

The stories you can experience are not only very different and crisp, they sometimes touch each other so that if you've already gone one path, you might be reminded of something that happened in the other path, only that in this path it's not really affecting you. So it feels really well thought-out and you keep on guessing, what might be the big mystery of each story and even though I flatter myself to be good in foreseeing the ending or the background of a story, I was hopelessly pushed around by so many theories I made up. So the game gives you hints but it's still pretty hard to find out until the end. (It's also hard to figure out, which answer is best to get your desired ending).

About the characters I must say that they really have very different personalities and you end up liking everyone in their own way. My first path was Ikki and I didn't like Kent from the beginning. But when I got to his path and storyline, I ended up smiling and liking him so very much. I'm glad I didn't skip him.

One story was kind of... borderline and some dialogues or happenings in the game shouldn't be seen as more than drama in a game (the asian cultures likes to push drama to it's limits I guess). Of course all this is not to be seen serious and only (science) fiction without the display of real relationships in our world. But that's what you play a gome for. To experience something different to our world and have fun. 

Despite the fact that your character really seems a bit faceless (which might be because of her memory-loss - though it's at least handy to not have a heroine you don't like...) and the sometimes borderline scenes, there was one thing that I would have liked different. There are seemingly only three types of music. The normal track, the drama/dangerous track and the soft/lovely track. That's all... You mostly play with the same music and even though it's at least not obtrusive, it's a bit boring. The voice-acting was pretty good though and I fell in love with most of them. (I guess I'm going to learn japanese now...)

Important for me is also the amount of decisions you can make and here I'm perfectly satisfied and how they change the story.
The trophies and the mini games are really cool too and even though I was quick in finishing these extras, I had fun. 

After all it's a game made with heart and great characters and stories (I do love Orion so much and would have loved to have a path with him too x) ) and I really enjoyed myself, smiling and giggling every so often and I'd recommend the game to everyone, who's got no problem seeing this as a game (as some didn't like, how they represented relationships) and has interest in versatile, interesting stories and boys :) 
I bought it in winter sale and I am glad about it. I had much fun and joy, even though I would have to think about it buying it for 28 Euros, so you might consider waiting for the next sale.
Have fun :)

29054709.review:
Engaging enough to finish, but only truly enjoyable if:

[b]1. You don't need an interesting heroine.[/b]
You learn a couple minutes into the game that the Heroine has lost her personality in addition to her memories.  [spoiler]When she gets it back, she's still not particularly interesting.[/spoiler]

[b]2. You're okay with the Heroine having no thoughts of her own.[/b]
For most of the game Orion just tells her the thoughts she should have.

[b]3. You're fine with player choices being only what to say, not what to do.[/b]
Orion, not the player, controls the Heroine's actions.  When he seems to offer a choice, it's often fake. (Example: Orion asks, "Do you want to go or not?" If the player chooses "not go," Orion replies, "But I think we should," and the Heroine goes.)

[b]4. You're cool with last century's beliefs about sexual harassment and violence.[/b]
Quote from a love interest in the game: "If you invite a man into your room when you're alone, you've basically already consented [to sex]."  Quote from another guy: "If you're not careful, I may do terrible things to you."  And another: "If you don't struggle, I won't know when to stop."  (Is this a Japanese thing?  There were sexual threats/harassment/violence by love interests in the other two Japanese otome I've tried.)


[b]5. You believe love will magically solve any emotional problem, no matter how violent and complex.[/b]
[spoiler]Example 1: Love interest is a mentally ill murderer?  Tell him you love him, bring him home, and all will be well. Example 2: Love interest has you pinned by the neck and is deciding to force himself on you and break you?  Convince him that you've always loved him, and he'll decide to treat you right![/spoiler] Those are, by the way, "Good Endings."


[u]Recommendation:[/u] Skip this.  There's better stuff available.
If you want something similar but with fewer problems, try "Dandelion - Wishes brought to you."  
If you don't mind shorter games, try some of the not-on-Steam free ones, like "Nusantara: Legend of the Winged Ones." (lemmasoft.renai.us is your friend.)

Amnesia Memories is one of the best otome games I've played next to Code Realize and Nameless. The story pulls you in because it’s so engaging, the art is gorgeous and the characters are memorable. This was the first professional otome game that I ever played, and it quickly became one of my favourites. The whole game is a wonderful experience and I’m guilty of revisiting it whenever I need some wish fulfilment (Kent)  I’m not going to lie, there were some horror vibes (diamond route and the bad ends *shudders*) that have become infamous from this game, but tbh they just added to the story rather than took away. 
Spoilers: [spoiler] I can see why Toma’s route makes some people uncomfortable but the comments I’ ve seen directed at the creators are ridiculous. I don’t believe that they are endorsing this type of behaviour as healthy, it’s just a take on obsessive behaviour taken to the extreme for storytelling purposes. I personally found Diamond route intense but interesting, having to walk on egg shells around Toma whilst trying to figure out what was happening at MC’s apartment. Overall it was entertaining, and that’s all I really wanted as a consumer. [/spoiler]Just my two cents on the matter.

28892864.review:
I bought this game during the Steam Winter Sale and felt deceived by all the overwhelmingly positive reviews. Firstly, I have to say I enjoyed the art and voice-acting. The story was intriguing enough that I played through all five worlds so that I could figure out the entire mystery.

But Amnesia left me with a really bad taste in my mouth. It doesn't portray any healthy relationships, and makes light of verbal and sexual abuse, kidnapping, and murder in the name of love. It feels like the company is going for  dark, edgy stories, but they're creating some really horrible and abusive male characters in the process. "Anything is okay, as long as I love you" is the message that gets sent. It's not romantic or beautiful, it's creepy and disturbing. I didn't get the warm, fluffy feelings I was looking for, but unsettling ones instead.

I needed brain bleach after Toma's route, in which you're held hostage "for your own protection." Shin, the token bad boy that dishes out tough love and verbally abuses you throughout his entire story, was intolerable. Yes, there is Kent, the only normal one, but he was too little, too late. Playing through all the routes, I didn't feel as if I was being offered different stories about love, but more of the same crap treatment. While I wanted to run in the opposite direction, getting the good endings required me to love him unconditionally no matter what he did to me. I know Amnesia is a work of fiction, but toxic relationships should not be romanticized. I really wish the men were better people. Then I would have actually enjoyed this game.

It also made me uncomfortable and gross to play as a helpless female character that goes along with everything the men feel like doing and saying to her. She is sexually harassed in most of the routes. She is drugged and caged in a second, and murdered multiple times in a third. Yet, she says nothing, never fights back, and forgives instantly. For the entirety of the game, she comes off as a passive and docile robot doll whose life revolves around not offending her love interest. I wonder if the developers think this is an attractive way to act in relationships--meek, obedient, and willing to forgive all the horrible things done to her. The MC could have easily been written as someone proactive and smart, and unwilling to take BS. I would play the hell out of a game like that. But instead, we got someone whose dialogue choices are literally "..." or "...Um."

Lastly, all the other women in the game, with the exception of her best friend, Sawa, are created to be jealous of the attention MC is receiving from men to the point of bullying and attempting murder on her. It really aggravates me when female characters are created to be so one dimensional, as if women's lives revolve solely around hating and plotting against each other.

Honestly, I feel bad that I supported a game like this instead of one with healthy portrayals of relationships, respectful treatment and representation of women, and a strong heroine. I'm in the process of playing Nameless ~The one thing you must recall~ by Cheritz, the amazing company that developed Mystic Messenger. So far, I would highly recommend it over Amnesia. The MC has a personality and the men are likable and not creepy. Cheritz also made Dandelion - Wishes brought to you -. Please consider giving these games some love.

28732202.review:
I bought this game shortly after its release (It was discounted a bit, I think about 10% or so?). I had already watched the anime, so I knew a few things about the characters beforehand. I love how all of them are more than what you see at first glance, there's always another layer hidden underneath what you see immediately.

There's Shin, your kinda tsundere childhood friend,[spoiler] who manages to figure out you don't have your memories immediately. He's been into you for so long, and depsite acting a bit aloof at times, he cares deeply and will fight to make you fall in love with him again.[/spoiler]

Ikki, the flirty guy who seems to change girlfriends more often than he does his clothes. [spoiler]But it wasn't him who started it - [i]They[/i] broke up with [i]him[/i]. So he decided if that's all he gets, he'll just have fun, despite still hoping for actual love.[/spoiler]

Kent, a guy who studies math and seems almost emotionless. [spoiler]He's trying, he's just so incredibly bad with people. He even researches how to act with your girlfriend, trying to make you happy.[/spoiler]

Toma, your other childhood friend who's been almost like your older brother (Which he even calls himself in other routes). [spoiler]OH GREAT NOW THAT DARN YANDERE DRUGGED YOU AND PUT YOU IN A CAGE! [s]He honestly scared the hell out of me, sorry Toma fans[/s].[/spoiler]

And after finishing all others, you get access to Ukyo's route. [spoiler]Yep, that guy who seemed rather deranged and, depending on your play style, may have killed you before. Talking about him would take up WAY too much space, so I won't do so here.[/spoiler]

Every boy has several endings. One good, one normal and several bad, depending on your relationship with him (Although some choices get you immediate Bad Ends), so you have more than enough reason to play the game again and again, trying out the other choices. Since you can save at any time, there's nothing stopping you from especially trying out the ones you immediately know are bad.

I've gotten 100% in this game, all endings, all CGs, all achievements... I wish it was longer. I heard there existed sequels, so maybe there's a chance those get released via Steam as well.

28403438.review:
Ok here we go.
*For everyones account, Even though I used to watch a lot of animes and read mangas, I havent been going into japanese games/animes/mangas, datings sims, or anything closer for a long time. But this thing raised my inner weeb back i guess. 
*Second, I watched the anime of Amnesia:Memories, It was a looong time ago, but I remember not liking it at all. I mean, I gave a 4/10 for it, thats how much I didint like it. I'm also more of a shounen person than a shoujo lover, though I'm a female.

PROS
+ ART - For the love of god its truly beautiful. Some people might get annoyed with the clothes that characters are wearing, but for me, only the lower parts of them were looking weird and you rarely see characters half lower believe me. 
+ SOUND - UGH. It was great! The musics are not boring, and on the point. I never went like, "Hey, what kind of music is this its weird for this part" Creepy scenes and music actually sent chills down my spine. I'm easily scared tho.
+ STORY - Ok this is not one of your cliche slice of life storylines, believe me. It actually makes you wonder, It actually makes you think about what really fucking happened, the storylines are well constructed, and actually have different tastes. And like I said in sound part, some lines of the story actually made me scared, or sometimes laugh, even tho it was rare for me.

CONS
- Clothes for some people? I dunno, upper halves are to die for, lower parts are, I didin't really cared cause I rarely saw them.
- Heroine. It's just like anime, the character you play [spoiler] doesnt have any actual freaking character at all. In every storyline, you actually realize that she acted differently to different people, not just that, you really have no idea why would these people fell in love with the Heroine, because shes an empty shell.[/spoiler] PROS OF THIS: [spoiler]you're not stuck with a heroine you don't really like most of the time, dream. I guess It's good she's not a dumb 3rd grader that youd hate. [/spoiler]

Not CONS not PROS
 = Ugh achievements. I mean, Story achievements are fun to get because that's what makes this game beautiful, storylines, but ffs that Gallery sound achievement is just ridiculous.
=  Mini games. OK they're rather easy, but just to let you know, Air Hockey game can get annoying because the faster you try to move, the faster the FPS drops. Remember, this game was made for Vita, not PC. 

TL;DR
It's an amazing game for otome/visual novel lovers. A must have I say. For people who are not really into them, If you're not cringing by just seeing shoujos/animes, then just try it, storylines won't really bore you, and they're enjoyable a lot.

28340401.review:
This was an excellent game. Were there routes that I didn't enjoy very much, sure. But this didn't take away from my over all enjoyment of the game itself. There were times that I found myself frustrated with the heroine and my lack of ability to answer the way I felt I would (there we a good few "Oh hell no's" that I would have liked to slap down now and then but couldn't). But an otome game cannot reasonably encompass any and all possible reactions that a person would have to a situation and still tell a cohesive story. On that note the story here is, in my opinion, a good one. It is also a rather expansive amount of content for the price. While a good deal of my hours logged were spent leaving the game on while I did other things, I still spent several hours playing through this game and getting each end.

There's also a bit of a culture gap for this game. It's not severe (and by no means a reason to over look the game) but it's definitely there. This occationally frustrated me as well, the way the males act with the heroine at times and the meek way that she reacts probably stems from a culture thing more then her being a "weak character" as some are prone to describe. I try to remind myself when playing games that originate somewhere so different that in certain cultures it is seen as attractive or appropriete for a man to tell a woman she shouldn't let other men look at her, or to grab her and roughly drag her away and then yell. This is seen as being "manly" and "protective", it is considered a good trait in a partner. Though I may strongly disagree with that conclusion, my culture is different.

TLDR: It's a really good game and if you like otome games you should play it. I mean grab it on sale if you're hesitant but grab it. It's worth it.

Small list of pros and cons

Pros:
Story is great
Characters are well thought out
Few minigames and extra's for when you need a break from the main game

Cons:
If you play for too long the main story gets really dull and boring
Some choices seem to make no sense at all
The way the protagonist acts can be really infuriating at times (way too naive for example)

All in all I just wish there was a neutral recommend option, because this game is as much fun as it isnt. Not worth the full pricing but if you can get it for about 10 bucks I'd say its worth it.

27629173.review:
This game is very well-made, it has no writing mistakes as far as I've aware of, and the character models are interesting and very colorful with their details.

The routes are all interesting and full of pleasurable, euphoric moments, tight olaces, humor, and interesting turns. However, the meters in the game have very much been only a decoration, since they do not help you at all most of the time. The best example of that is Toma.

For your first playing time, you should choose anyone but Toma. Trust me, his path is not logical at all, and you may end up having a frustrative bad ending even if you do not set it as your goal. You may want to enjoy the other, better routes at first.

The four different characters are all very different. Toma is secretive and shows his kind mask, Shin is a bit of a cool delinquent, who is very smart and amazing sometimes. Ikki is a womanizer on the outside, but he has more to it. Kent is sosially very thick-headed, but clever as a mathbook. And needless to say, your companion spirit-boy Orion is very entertaining with all the comments and funny faces he does. He really adds more to the game.

Also, the starting music is awesome and the soundtrack is nicely supporting the athmosphere. The artwork is neatly done.

So, if you like interesting stories, cool-looking guys and cute shotas from other dimensions, this is definitely your new investment.

27624417.review: Such lovely art and music. Engaging story too with tons of outcomes

27623560.review:
Scarred for life by this game. I'm really not into men who keep women in cages without their consent. 

On a more serious note, my consensus: Definitely not the best visual novel I've played, but definitely not the worst. You can tell a lot of effort and polish had gone into this game, it's very well made and gorgeous to look at, even if the writing and characters fell flat for me. Considering how rare it is for games of any substance to be translated from Japanese, and how widely known and popular this game is I'd likely reccomend this to any otome/romance gamer... just know what you're getting into. II seem to be mostly alone in my opinion that it's cliche ridden in a bad way, and quite frustrating. The plot had a lot of potential, some of the characters did too, it just didn't hit any of the right notes for me. On top of that, there is a LOT of non-consenual/violent behaviour/groping/pinning/bad stuff, which is EXTREMELY BAD in a certain route, less present in the others but still definitely a factor. I can't stand this kind of behaviour glorified, not just in the 'yandere route' but in the others that are supposed to be far from that. There are otome games that handle yandere/violent characters in ways that make it interesting, this is not one of them.

However, there's a lot of content in this game, considering the price tag, and it's an absolute steal on sale. As aforementioned it'is not without it's flaws, quite stuck in standard character tropes and hindered by a frustratingly blank slate main character and cute-but-annoying-after-a-while sidekick. The appeal of the love interests is highly dependent on personal preference, it's not really a well rounded cast in my opinion. It's likely that one will appeal to you and the others will be 'meh' [strike]or AHHH GET AWAY FROM ME[/strike], which takes away from the overall enjoyment of the game. The plot was interesting enough to pull me through, though I thought it was poorly handled, once I'd commited to it I didn't stop.

So, should you buy this game? I don't know. I really don't. It was a mixed bag, but if supporting it means other Japanese games potentially being translated? I don't know. Did I enjoy this game? To an extent, yes. As a guilty pleasure type thing, and I enjoyed deconstructing it and what makes it so popular (as an aspiring otome developer) but... I feel uneasy reccomending it due to the aforemention points.

If you do but this game, don't start with the diamond world, that's all I have to say.

I've been wanting to try an otome game for quite awhile now, so I was really excited to finally get the opportunity with the release of Amnesia on Steam. I've played a handful of visual novels, but this was my first time getting to play an otome one.

As far as visual novels go, the story of this one was...interesting. I had read reviews of Amnesia, so I knew what I was getting into before I bought it. It's a strange cookie...definitely not my usual reading material. But I was thoroughly entertained, nonetheless. This is no masterpiece by any stretch of the imagination, but I think it more than qualifies as a guilty pleasure.

At the least, I enjoyed the game enough to want to play more otome games. So I'll be keeping an eye out for them on Steam. :)

O que dizer desse jogo que te destrói psicologicamente de todas as formas possiveis?
Já conhecia o mesmo desde a época que ainda não era disponivel para PC, assim como também assisti o anime que foi criado para fazer merchandising do jogo. 

O jogo não é apenas você conquistar seu 'senpai', ele tem muito mais que isso para oferecer. Ele te coloca em uma história onde você perde sua memória, normalmente sempre esta envolvida em algum problema social com os outros personagens. Além tambem do fato de você estar pulando de uma dimensão a outra, para depois descobrir algo realmente medonho. 

Vale a pena jogar TODAS as rotas para você entender o quão complexo é esse jogo, prepara também umas consultas com seu psicologo porque vai precisar haha. Para aqueles que viram o anime, o jogo é muito mais do que aquilo! Em vários momentos você vai ficar 'EOQ?!' com avanço da história, junte todas elas e sua mente explode. -Q

26842361.review:
Eu literalmente pulei de alegria quando esse jogo foi anunciado pela Idea Factory no ocidente, ainda mais com port para PC, tornando algo tão difícil - Um otome game de renome acessível, sem ser apenas em PSVITA ou PSP - em um jogo tranquilo para veteranas e moças que sequer sabiam da existência de um jogo de Amnesia. 
Deixando minha felicidade de lado um pouco, falemos sobre ele. Nossa protagonista perde suas memórias e, de repente, vê-se conectada a quatro (depois cinco) mundos com diferentes possibilidades de rapazes a sua espera, onde ela vai aos poucos recuperando (ou não) sua memória, criando novos laços e [strike]tendo cenas tão fofas que farão você apertar as próprias bochechas e fazer um som com a boca parecido com [i]squee![/i][/strike]
O design do jogo é absurdamente lindo. As cores mudam de acordo com o seu bae, e tudo se encaixa em uma harmonia tão perfeita a qual raramente vejo em jogos. 
Porém, algumas coisas me irritam em Amnesia.
A começar pelas personagens. Sim, eles são lindos e maravilhosos, porém muito mal explorados. Digo, poderiam ter falado muito mais do passado do Shin, ou ido além da "maldição" do Ikki. A exceção do Toma (melhor personagem no sentido história) e um pouco do Ukyo, o resto deixa a desejar, sendo rasos e com pouco conteúdo a oferecer além do romance.
A história em si poderia ser um pouco mais lenta, pois algumas partes ficam mal explicadas ou "corridas", sem muita profundidade. Parece que ela simplesmente ama o boy sem ele ter feito nada. 
Porém, no sentido da relação boy-heroine, fica pouco a desejar. Têm cenas fofas, e elas vão te deixar corada. Nisso, o game cumpre seu papel. 
A trilha sonora e planos de fundo são muito pessoais. Gostei muito de uns, não muito de outros. E pronto. Vai de cada um, mesmo.
Concluindo, esse jogo é um must-play. Se você gosta de romance e amorzinho, você precisa ter esse jogo. Meio carinho porém vale a pena - são muitas horas de gameplay até pegar todos os finais. Tome cuidado que alguns finais dão medo e podem te deixar mal. Todavia nada de temível.
E aproveite, pois é um excelente jogo!

Storyline following the Amnesia anime, thankfully this makes a lot more sense due to the depth of detail in comparision. 

You start as an unnamed female protagonist who wakes up with no memory of who she is or anything in her life, the first person she meets is a spirit named Orion.  Orion guides her through every parrellel universe with logic and reasoning to help her find her lost memories.

Each character is misunderstood in someway due to their past and connection with *you*.  With multiple endings for everyone and unexpected twists and emotions, you will be playing this game for days at least.  So far I have clocked over 24 hours and not even scratched the surface, dispising, hating, misunderstanding and loving different characters in each parellel universe.  The only guarantee is your heart will skip a beat each time you learn the truth.

26566065.review:
Don't pay much attention to my in-game time, as I've played "Amnesia: Memories" mostly offline. This game definitely stands out from visual novels on Steam, especially other titles coming from Asian studios. Shortly speaking: story is very interesting, there is a secret to discover, characters are great, idea unique and graphic pleasant. This doesn't mean "Amnesia: Memories" is a game without a flaw, but I will write more about it below. Also, if you haven't played the game yet, I recommend you to go through routes in order presented in game: Heart World, Spades World, Clover World and leave Diamond World to the [spoiler]almost[/spoiler] very end.

[h1]Good things[/h1]

[b]Art.[/b] I have absolutely nothing bad to say about visuals - CGs are beautiful, same goes for characters models and even though backgrounds are very simplistic, they feel unique.

[b]Characters.[/b] I will write a little bit more about protagonists and her possible boyfriends below, but generally speaking, characters are very strong point of this game. Each of them has their good and bad sides, each of them can be liked. I also enjoyed secondary characters, especially Waka.

[b]Writing.[/b] Writing is very good and same goes for translation - very often translated games are overly simplistic in terms of used words and dialogues tends to looks fake, but here everything is polished.

[b]Story.[/b] There is a depth to this game, few secrets to uncover, there are also some darker corners that you may find yourself in, if you made a bad choices along the way. I really like the sense of threat in this game. The atmosphere really drags you in, even on the routes that may be less interesting. 

[b]MC isn't a victim.[/b] After my long and painful adventures with Dandelion and Nameless, where protagonists were presented as the most unhappy people in the world, despite not having legitimately good reasons for it, this was a very refreshing thing. Especially since here, protagonist actually could easily be painted that way - she suffers from memory loss, she hears a spirit that never shuts up (seriously, dear God!), she doesn't know who to trust, on few routes she is almost murdered, her life and health is in danger, yet neither she, nor other characters, refers to her in a way that makes her look like a constant victim.

[b]Price.[/b] I will be honest with you, if Amnesia: Memories is a type of game you would enjoy, full price for the whole content is almost a steal, especially if it's compared to other titles available on Steam. Each route (4 normal + secret one) has one good, one normal and at least two bad ends to experience. There is fair amount of text, CGs, there are extras, like gallery and even mini-games and additional scenes to unlock. Also, if you can't afford the full price, wait for sale - this games usually get a big discount, so you can buy it for around 5$.

[b]Endings.[/b] Most of good/normal endings felt very satisfying to me. Actually, on some routes I preferred normal ending over good one, because it seem more natural to the characters. Bad ends really deserve a praise and the reason is rather simple. Very often, in visual novels, bad ends comes out of nowhere. You made a wrong choice somewhere and then suddenly you end up dead, in some strange love triangle, as a sex slave or something similarly "pleasant" even though it's never established before or hinted in any way. Here, pretty much every bad ending feels natural to the story. Usually [spoiler]Toma, Ukyo or Ikky's fans are the one causing protagonist harm[/spoiler] and their intentions are obvious, so when something bad happens, it has more meaning and sense.

[h1]Bad things[/h1]

[b]Orion.[/b] Yes, he's cute, for like first few scenes and then he gets more annoying with every spoken word. Just shut up, Orion, please, I don't need to you to repeat to me what I just witnessed or tell me how I should feel or perceive certain things, seriously, I'm playing this, am I not?! Of course Orion serves his purpose sometimes, but most of the time it seems like he's there just to cover the fact that protagonist says few sentences during whole route. There were moments when I was getting so frustrated with his long obvious monologues that I just skipped them and I rarely do that.

[b]Protagonist.[/b] Now, this one is not that obvious. Despite her not being a victim, she's still a classic VN protagonist - naive, innocent and almost completely silent. I get it, she has amnesia and she tries to cover it, still, it would be nice for her to speak up a little bit more and ask about something for a change. That being said, amnesia is a pretty good explanation after all. Also, during flashbacks, protagonist has a bit more to say and from her boyfriends/friends words about her "past self" it seems like she had a pretty strong personality. 

[b]Provoking, oh provoking.[/b] I was so tired of hearing MC chosen ones saying (or should I say threatening?) that they will have "their way with her" or that she provokes them by just sitting next to them, or that they won't be able to hold back and all that bs. You would imagine she's doing something really bold to get this sort of reactions, but nope, she's just... there. 

[b]Few route-specific aspects that I will mention below.[/b]

[h1]Routes[/h1]

[b]Shin.[/b] [spoiler]I really liked his route. He's cold-headed and seem too mean at first, but the truth is, he's just honest. He prefers painful truth over sweet lies. There is an intriguing story here, about finding the culprit who harmed main character and even though it's fairly obvious, there were moments when I was suspecting Sawa.[/spoiler]

[b]Ikkyu.[/b] [spoiler]He's my least favorite. He's the most cliche of them all, his super eyes were beyond my suspension of disbelief, I didn't feel like he actually made an effort to make protagonist like him - he was just overly pushy and pretty creepy at times. Sorry, Ikkyu, but I don't think I would be willing to live under one roof with someone who openly states that he won't be able to hold his advances on me, to then change his mind and say that he was joking, to then change his mind again and say that I shouldn't be surprise if that happens. Thanks, but no thanks, stay with your fanclub.[/spoiler]

[b]Kent[/b] [spoiler]turned out to be my absolute favorite one. He's just so adorable at times, he tries to calculate his every move, he's very non-sociable and inexperienced in human relations. I felt like protagonist was the most honest with him and he, despite scientific approach, respected her explanation. He's also very caring and serious in his intentions from the very beginning.[/spoiler]

[b]Toma.[/b] [spoiler] Riiight. So I get it, we are on dangerous territory now, because some people adore Toma and defend him while others write this game a negative review only because his route is THAT way. So yeah, Toma is a creep. If this was your first route and you're, understandably, not into this sort of stuff, you may be disgusted and not enthusiastic to experience other routes. That being said, I don't feel like this route was as bad as it could be and I don't mean Toma's behavior. It was well written. On other routes (especially Shin's) there are heavy hints that Toma's feelings towards MC are very weird and that he's able to do bad things to her. When I was playing this route, I honestly felt the sense of threat, it was disturbing, like a good thriller story should be. I felt like my objective was to get as far away from this a-hole as I can and honestly, I would really wish if they went with something like that on good/normal endings and not classic Stockholm Syndrome: you've locked me up in cage and almost raped me, but I love you, so let's be together forever <3. Still, I would say it was enjoyable route, in this "thriller-ish" way. [/spoiler]

26513332.review:
Oh. My. Goodness.
This game is absolutely fantastic. I enjoyed every minute while playing this game. I loved all of the characters and how different they were from each other, the voice acting was amazing, the art is great, and the music was perfect at setting the mood. I truly wish I could play this again for the first time, even though I just finished every route and every possible ending just minutes ago.

First of all, Orion (the MC's companion) is absolutely adorable. He truly made the game entertaining with his snarky side comments. At many points, he stated my exact IRL reaction to things that the boys say to the MC, and it's absolutely hilarious. He is the MC's voice of reason (usually). All of the romanceable boys were likable (although Ikki was my least favorite, but I still like him!) and each route brings something new to the table. I was not once bored playing this game. It's nice to see not only the boys grow during their routes, but the MC as well. When you can actually see her personality shine through, she's extremely likeable.

Now, when I say all of the romanceable boys were likable, I know people will disagree with me since "Diamond World" boy is, uh, pretty crazy. Well, he is, it's true. Despite how insane he is, I did enjoy his route. It was very unconventional and portrayed the yandere type quite well. I enjoy when otome games shake things up a bit, so I found his route to be interesting. The MC seemed like she had some sort of stockholm syndrome thing goin' on if you play to get the good end... I'd rather have her knock some sense into him, but that's just me! At least the good end for him was nice. Anyways, all of the boys have some sort of flaw, but that's what makes them more interesting, real, and it drives the game further. They can't be perfect--that'd be boring.

The confusion you feel starting each route leaves you binging the game in order to get answers. The good endings of each route were very satisfying and the bad endings were FUN! Some of them are quite morbid, but good Lord, they're fun to see.

This game was an emotional rollercoaster. I cried, laughed, got a bit angry at certain characters for being absolutely psychotic... but, my God, let me tell you: the true ending for the 5th romanceable character was heartwrenching. I absolutely adored it, though. The "true" 5th route answers all of your questions and leaves you with a sense of "Ah, I understand now!" and it does not fall short of being satisfying.

I really don't have much to analyze or go in depth over in this review. The game is just... yes.
I highly recommend it if you like otome visual novels. It's a must play for the genre. Here's to hoping that they eventually localize the other Amnesia titles soon. Take all my money.

26447968.review:
I've played many visual novels. This one doesn't have any gratuitous nudity or sex scenes. Now that half of you have probably stopped reading I have to say this was an interesting game. This time you play a girl and have the option of getting to know 4 unique guys . I have to say the whole amnesia aspect was interesting. As you are interacting with each guy you have to recover your memories and the feelings you had for them while not letting them know you've lost your memories. 

I found myself invested in each story more than I'd ever care to admit. In such a way that you start to have favorites. The guys all have distinct personalities in how they act with you. Some are pushy, while others are cold and indifferent. As they warm up to you and get more familiar you find yourself warming up to them and you learn that they're not as heartless their initial personality. 

There is an underlying mystery that includes one secret guy who you can only play out once you've finished the ending of each of the main 4. This is a little more scary as you will discover him in other play throughs and adds a bit of horror element to the game. There are 3 types of endings, good, normal and bad. Bad usually ends with your death and you'll see it coming once the music changes. And boy does that music send chills down your spine once it starts and you realize that something bad is going to happen you can't help but feel a bit of terror. 

While the entire game is spoken in Japanese there is an option to skip or fast forward a lot of the seen dialogue so subsequent playthroughs are quicker. And to get all the endings you're going to have to replay quite a bit. There's a bit of trial and error in balancing out your relationships and sometimes the choices you're presented with aren't so clear as to what outcome it will lead. Despite that I enjoyed the story and diverse personalities of the guys you date. You should play this if you are a fan of VNs otherwise without the sex and nudity I think it wouldn't be for everyone.

26442867.review:
Ich kannte vorher den Anime "Amnesia" und habe ihn bereits geliebt.
Das Spiel schuf das Fundament zu der wunderschönen Animeserie und umfasst vier Geschichtsverläufe mit je vier verschiedenen Enden.

Die Charaktere sind in einem schönen Anime-Zeichenstil gehalten und wirken alle ähnlich sympathisch, wenn man erst die Erzählstränge mitverfolgt.
Ich spielte zuerst natürlich erst die Storys um meine Favoriten und musste feststellen, dass es doch recht schwer ist, das gute Ende zu erhalten. 

Die Dialoge kann man glücklicherweise auch beschleunigen, sodass man nicht alles so oft lesen muss. 
Beim Spielen werden die Bilder und Szenen in der Gallery gespeichert, sodass man sie auch später nochmals aufrufen kann.

All in all empfehle ich dieses Spiel jenen, die sowohl die Animeserie als auch Anime generell lieben und Visual Novels mögen.
Die Serie als auch das Spiel ist meiner Meinung nach eher für Frauen ausgelegt. Männer könnten sich aber vielleicht dennoch an die süßen und sexy Charaktere erfreuen.

26401978.review:
First of all, I got this on sale for like $10, and if you go by time alone it was worth it.  It's really long.  I let it autoplay with all the voice acting and basically watched it like a video (while doing other things).  Used a guide to make all the choices to unlock the final route.

This is definitely one of those VNs where all of the datable guys are horrible people and yet the MC doesn't care at all.  I'm not sure there was a single guy I actually thought was an okay person in this game.  Spoilers: You've got the boy-next-door who's mean to you, the smart guy who's really condescending, the guy who seduces girls with his eyes but it's okay because he can't help it (strangely, also the least creepy and annoying one), and the guy who straight up kidnaps you and locks you in a cage.  And if you do the "secret" route, the guy who seems alright but has an alternate personality who's totally insane.  And your MC's just like, yeah, that's cool with me.  I spent the whole time simultaneously feeling bad for the MC and wishing she wasn't a clueless idiot.

I liked the "alternate universes where you date a different guy in each one" idea, though, and that's why I played through it all.  An interesting way to give meaning to the way you usually play these VNs over and over getting all the different endings, and the routes were quite different from one another unlike in some games.  The plot wasn't super well-tied together at the end, but it was alright.

In conclusion, play this if you have a high tolerance for creepiness, otherwise you probably shouldn't.

26370356.review:
Definitely recommended.

I loved the story. It has pretty much everything in it; mystery, suspicion, supernatural, humor and of course, romance. It's a perfect mix of everything that interests me, so naturally it would be an instant hit with me. And it was. All of the routes are different, with varying dominant genres in them (one character is more focused on mystery, another on suspicion) and your relationships with the side characters change as well, depending on who you chose. So things change in every route enough to keep you interested, even in the similar settings.

I LOVED almost every romanceable character and even the side characters! They're a group of colorful personalities, with good and bad characteristics. What I liked about this game is that despite seeing the good and the bad, I didn't hate any of the romanceable characters. They might have stereotypical personalities at first glance, but there's more to it, for all characters. They are not perfect, but I still loved them. Perhaps even more because of it. 

The art is GORGEOUS. I liked the amount of color this game had, especially on the characters. The background stayed very mellow with extremely light colors, but it worked. The focus is more on the characters as it should be. The CGs are beautiful, but so is rest of the game.

The animation was a nice touch. I wouldn't have minded if they didn't have it, but it does make them more real. They don't just blink, their mouths move too. Combined with the incredible, emotional voice acting... I have no words. A tiny thing that I did notice was that the mouths might still move even if there's a pause in the voice, but I only just saw it, so I was fine with it.

I haven't played that many otome games, but I have played enough to say that the gameplay was HARD. First of all, there's three different meters (affection, trust and suspicion) and you weren't informed what rose after a choice. And if you checked the parameters, you didn't necessarily see where the change happened. IF anything happened. It was really hard for me because I wanted to play without a guide, but I couldn't avoid it. I could reach a Normal End without a guide, but Good End was too difficult.

Despite the last part, I full heartedly recommend this game. It's has an extremely interesting story, beautiful visuals, lovable male characters and likeable female ones, and amazing voice acting. I might have bought it on sale but if this game ever got a physical English release, I would buy it. Full price.

While I have yet to see all the endings for this game, I have seen all the true endings for this game so I thought now would be a good time to review it. 

Overall I really enjoyed playing this game. I loved the art, enjoyed several of the routes as well as the overall story. I think I only really liked 2 of the 5 possible guys to date but I still enjoyed the other ones as I was able to get the good end with all the routes. I also felt like this game was a good length as it took me around 40 hours just to get though all the good endings, which is well worth the money spent on this game. I still have a couple more hours to spend with this game as there are some other endings I would like to try to get as well as some extras. 

I don't think I have any major criticisms with this game to be honest. Sometimes the story can feel rather over the top but I found myself laughing at those bits rather then being annoyed by them. If there is one thing I would want to see changed in this game is to make it easier to skip to certain days as while I did save, I found it annoying having to skip  through so much text and I found it much difficult replaying certain routes..

If you can get this game on sale and are wanting to try out an Otome then I do recommend this one. 

Overall rating: 7.5/10

26178449.review:
[b]Коротко:[/b] рекомендуется к прохождению любительницам отоме и охотникам на идеальные игры. Просто любителям хороших визуальных новелл можно сюда не заглядывать, упустят не много. В целом игра получает от меня 7,5/10.

[b]Подробно, с небольшими спойлерами (коротые я постараюсь спрятать) и отсебятиной:[/b]
В целом игра оставила довольно приятное впечатление, несмотря на мой изначально негативный настрой. Этот настрой был вызван высокой по моим меркам ценой для ВН, негативными отзывами в Стиме и общей моей нелюбовью к жанру отоме. Играю я в них чисто ради любопытства в поисках интересных сюжетных идей, в надежде найти неплохую игру или ради достижений (как в данном случае). Но игра, хоть и не сразу, но стала...неплохой. Сложно подобрать слова, чтобы описать точное впечатление. Но оценку заслуживает определённо выше среднего. И хотя иногда игра утомляет или раздражает, в целом это компенсируется теми или иными элементами.
Хочется обратить особое внимание на следующие пункты. Здесь вперемешку и плюсы, и минусы (придирки по большей части), и просто впечатления.
- В техническом плане игра выполнена неплохо.
- Непривычное управление. Я знаю, что игра делалась под PlayStation, но некоторые функции вызывают неудобства и их находишь лишь заглянув в управление. Например, S - перемотка, а не сохранение; а переходить на следующую реплику возможно только при нажатии левой клавиши мыши и нет альтернативы на клавиатуре (из-за если у меня занята правая рука, мне неудобно играть левой)
- Настольный хоккей хотелось бы не разворачивать боком. Больше всего шайб было мной пропущено именно из-за повернутого горизонтально поля. Если хотите на компьютере поиграть в качественный настольный хоккей - лучше выберите Shufflepuck Cantina, а не эту игру. Играть разве что ради ачивок.
- Качественная озвучка с хорошими голосами, хотя иногда можно заметить разницу в качестве записи голосов некоторых персонажей.
- Ненавязчивое и довольно приятное звуковое сопровождение. Это касается по большей части музыки. А вот со звуками бывают проблемы. Некоторые звуки очень резко вставлены и выбиваются из общей атмосферы. А ещё меня раздражает этот телефонный звонок у героини (не смс-ки).
- Приятный арт-стиль. Хорошо отрисованные персонажи и локации. Хотя концепты персонажей не совсем мне по вкусу. Они все одеваются довольно странно. При этом они ещё умудряются что-то высказывать по поводу "Он так странно одет", хотя сами одеты не лучше. Это вызывает недоумение. А ещё иногда у персов бывают странные выражения лиц. Но такого мало, пальцев одной руки хватит чтоб их перечислить.
- Главная героиня. На большей части CG она выглядит как кукла со своим [почти всегда] пустым взглядом и [иногда] странной мимикой, из-за чего её сложно воспринимать как живого человека. Не могу вспомнить ни одной ВН, где ГГ выглядит столь же неестественно. Это особенно выделяеся на фоне качественно прорисованных остальных персонажей. Так же следует отметить и её кукольное поведение. То есть героиня почти всю игру молчит, и мы не имеем ни малейшего представления что вообще творится у неё в голове. Это [i]можно[/i] представить как попытку погрузить игрока глубже в сюжет (якобы нет никакой ГГ, это игрок и его собственные мысли и т.д. и т.п.), но на деле такого ощущения не создаётся. Личность героини просто отсуствует до тех пор, пока она не дойдёт до концовки. Хотя изредко она и проявляется посреди сюжета в странных вариациях. Вообще её личность подавляется следующими двумя пунктами этого списка.
...

[отзыв не помещается, завершение в комментариях]

Tons of content. I knew there were multiple routes, but I expected them to follow a similar storyline. In reality, each bachelor had their own unique story, which means you're going to be getting at least 20 hours of gameplay and every character will get plenty of development. 

The stories are interesting. Some were more interesting than others, but all were worth playing through.  The game is fully voiced with quite a few CG and several endings per character.  The pricetag can be hard to swallow if the game's not on sale, but this really is a professional quality visual novel. 

The game has several pretty dark endings, and some of the routes themselves are pretty dark. So if you're into that, this will be your jam.  If you just want a fluffy otome, this might not be right for you.

25891487.review:
En una simple palabra: JUEGAZO! 

Pero vayamos por partes y empezemos por el principio:

Tiene una intro preciosa con buena música. Algo que siempre es más agradable que empezar el juego con una pantalla fija. Además, en el menú inicial, da la opción de jugar a dos minijuegos sin necesidad de hacer nada para desbloquearlos. Y nunca en mi vida había disfrutado tanto el jugar a piedras, papel o tijera. Divertido, tanto que incluso se echa de menos algún otro minijuego.

Las cuatro opciones iniciales que da para escoger entre cuatro mundos, representan a los cuatro chicos. Pero hay sorpresa al acabar todas las rutas. Todas las historias son divertidas y algunas están de ellas están en parte ligadas pero no se hacen repetitivas al variar las rutas. Es más, te quedas alucinada con lo que llegas a descubrir sobre ellos al escoger su historia. 

La música: agradable, para nada molesta o que no coincida con el momento; y las voces en japonés (que no es tanto pedir!!!). Si nos ponemos un poco quiquillosos, podemos decir que la voz a veces no cuadra del todo con los movimientos de la boca. Pero es que es buscar fallos por buscar. No da una mala impresión.

Apartado gráfico/artístico: Los fondos son más tenues, no parece que esté pegada una imagen sobre otra. Cosa que ya he visto más veces de las que me gustaría en otros juegos. El color tiene degradados y en general da una impresión muy agradable que resalta más a los personajes. Los chicos, pues sin quejas, los dibujos son impresionantes. Las poses también varían. No estás delante de una persona que siempre mantiene la misma pose. Se giran, dan la espalda, y además los personajes PARPADEAN. Puede parecer una tontería, pero es que cuando estás mirando la pantalla y te quedas con ese detalle, te parece que lo tengas delante de verdad. La impresión que deja es muy buena. Los CG's impresionantes, 10 de 10. Y es que a nivel gráfico, se pueden encontrar detalles que gusten más o menos, pero da la talla. Además es curioso encontrar alguna referencia al juego de Moujuutsukai to oujisama -Beastmaster and prince- (un póster del príncipe Lucia). Si no recuerdo mal es donde el cine.

La historia, creo que el propio nombre ya deja claro el tema, ¿no? Un recurso típico de los mangas pero encuentro que el juego le da una vuelta más al introducir al personaje de Orion. Es tan KAWAII que te lo llevarías a casa. Además los gestos que pone son divertidos y su voz muy agradable. Pero si queréis saber mejor a qué me refiero, os aconsejo jugarlo. Porque es de los mejores otome que he jugado para PC.

[b]Mi único "pero" es respecto a la dificultad de saber si vas por el camino adecuado dentro de una ruta.[/b] En cuanto a las respuesta correctas para un buen final, a veces puedes sudar un poco para saber si vas bien o no. Algunos personajes son más difíciles de "leer" que otros. Pero si te encuentras con un Bad ending, ya sabes que algo no fue bien.

25871397.review:
I tired my best to not put any spoilers! So I apologise if I do!

If you like lovely voice actors, bishounens and romance, this is perfect for you.
There are many choices to pick from, which will affect affection, trust and suspicion.
The art is wonderful, especially the CGs. 

If you watched the anime before this game, this game fills up all the gaps you missed. If you plan to watch the anime, after this game, don't. It is not worth it. You will be disappointed. (Well, the opening song from the anime is good though)

I loved this game, only thing that annoyed me would be that my achievements didn't register properly. 

Some routes may be quite hard to get the good ending, since as the protagonist, you must figure out what the ideal girl the guy wants.
For Shin, you have the be the protagonist you used to be, tsundere (-ish, not as much as Shin). For Ikki, obey this words. For Kent, be nice to him and so on.

Best route for your heart to go doki doki, would probably be Kent's good route. He is a sweetheart, and very adorable. 

This is what I think their dere types are!
Shin - Tsundere (very, very tsun), Ikki - Kuudere, Kent - Dandere (he is a sweetest, cutest person ever!), Toma - Yandere (be warned! You will probably judge the progagonist), Ukyo - ?dere (Who knows...?)

This game can also be quite lengthy, but it means it is story-rich! Well, rich in buildings up the love to the guys (not Toma, just, no)

What I also like about this game, is that each character's route is different from one another, even though the beginning may appear similar to some of them, but the story is really different. The Heroine's relationship between different characters do change, as well as the personality of them.

Ok! To sum it up, why I recommend this game!
Sweet, heartwarming and romantic routes (everyone but Toma)
Wonderful voices
Brilliant CGs
Orion (who is there to help you out)
Mini games to relax after or between routes
Long game time

Some things you may not like
Toma
Toma
Toma
Unrelatable protagonist

25276920.review:
Nem sei por onde começar, esse jogo é simplesmente maravilhoso!!

Pra quem é fã do gênero visual noval e, mais especificamente, otome games, definitivamente não vai se arrepender de jogar e vai ser uma das melhores experiências com esse tipo de jogo da sua vida!

O jogo apresenta 4 rotas principais + 1 rota extra que é desbloqueada após finalizar as 4 primeiras.

- TODAS as rotas apresentam histórias excelentes capazes de te prender do início ao fim a ponto de te fazer ficar viciada (cuidado!).

- TODOS os personagens são bem construídos e desenvolvidos do início ao fim da história. Você vai conhecendo eles cada vez mais e se apegando (ou odiando) também. O Orion é um personagem essencial para o desenvolvimento de todas as rotas, ele dá um ar de alívio cômico e divertimento ao longo de todo o jogo, fazendo com que toda a experiência de gameplay flua num ótimo ritmo!

- A MAIOR PARTE (não posso dizer todas porque bem... gostos) das cenas de romance são lindas, muito românticas e que farão o seu coração derreter e torcer por um final feliz!

- O jogo apresenta gráficos MARAVILHOSOS, todos os cenários, personagens e animações são muito bem desenhados e detalhados, fazendo com que você fique hipnotizada e fascinada pela competência artística.

- As dublagens e as músicas do jogo também SÃO ÓTIMAS e contribuem muito, sendo fundamentais para uma imersão completa da jogadora no contexto e na história do jogo. Além de tornarem os momentos emotivos ainda mais emotivos e especiais, com direito a um oceano de lágrimas!

- PLOT TWIST <333

Opinião geral:

Jogue, jogue, jogue, jogue!! Deixe esse jogo destruir a sua vida de um jeito positivo como fez com a minha!! Adote o Orion como filho (ou irmão mais novo, se preferir) e embarque nessa jornada com garotos lindos, doidos, medonhos e.... vou calar a boca, hehe.

Apenas jogue e não vai se arrepender!!

失忆症的动画很早以前一集一集追的，游戏去年打折的时候就买了，但是只通了一条Shin线就一直搁置了，直到最近才一口气把剩下的男主全攻略了ヾ(≧へ≦)〃。和女主一路走来，看着妹子一点点找回记忆和情感，终于过上幸福快乐的生活真的好感动o(*￣▽￣*)o！！

[spoiler]"第一个攻略的是Shin，因为动画里最喜欢他。有点S的傲娇年下是我喜欢的类型。剧情还是挺甜的，很直球也很有担当的男孩子，为了女主会默默学乐器，希望女主把他当男人而不是弟弟看待。小木屋的两天一夜真的很有推理游戏的气氛，Shin最后的表现也让我很感动。是很有担当的年下君呢。

然后是ikki，虽然一开始让人觉得这个迪卢木多的设定多么夸张！但是一旦接受了设定就会渐渐地理解和心疼他，身边没有普通朋友，而是永远围绕着一堆将自己当成真命天子对待的人，以致于过上普通的生活成为一种奢望。所以女主的存在才变得那么重要Q Q 另外他能有Kent这个好朋友真的是太好了，由衷地为他高兴

Kent君，可怕的超理性数学系男。前期那么的别扭，但是意识到自己的感情以后却意外的直白主动，HE的结局有点完美到不真实，好少女漫好偶像剧XD 但其实异地恋结局也可以很美很有想象的……

Toma线我玩的不是特别认真，比起伪暖男真病娇我可能还是更喜欢纯暖男，前期明明那么美好的……有时候一些重要的事情没能尽早说清楚，会多走那么多弯路，带来那么多无法想象的后果，甚至把两情相悦变成BE。

最后是Ukyo，虽然开Ukyo线需要第五周目但是真的希望大家都能通一次Ukyo线，作为一个游戏的真·结局，Ukyo线解释了整个游戏的世界观和这么多条线的由来，理解了之后再回想起前面四条线里的Ukyo的一举一动，瞬间又是一把40米长刀。。"[/spoiler]

总之能在steam补票失忆症真的超开心，特卖的时候不到10块钱，配音和剧情都很出色，因为木有简中所以边玩也边学习了英语hhh要是后续几作也能出PC版就好了我一定会买的啦

PS：通关了但是各条线HE的成就为什么没有达成QAQ

25029450.review:
Small spoilers ahead.

This game has easily surpassed my expectations. I believed that the story would end shallowly with "unique", hot guys longing for the main character as you, the player gets to pick. Not only does the character not talk 70% of the game on her own, but a spirit acts as her best friend who speaks the thoughts of the player (at least he thought what I did). This game isn't just about a girl with amnesia, the plot has twists upon twists. If you're one to not enjoy horror, it serves a purpose. It's not to scare you, but emphasize the love of a tortured character in the game. The art is breathtaking, the translation is greatly appreciated, the male voices are completely present throughout the game (including after choosing a response!), and the voice actors were practically destined to play their roles. There is more to the game than it leads on to. Mystery will always be prevelant until the very last world. 35 hours of gaming was completely worth $30. If I had to pick one visual novel game on steam, this would be the one to outshine the others.

24867332.review:
*Whistles* This game has become a favorite of mine so I've got a lot of good to say about it- it does have some down falls, of course, but I didn't find anything to be game ruining.

POSITIVES
-The visuals are really, really gorgeous. All the backgrounds are well made and the character models have a lot of detail. The character models in general are gorgeous, the clothes seem to have a marble-like texture and the eyes stand out. They even move from pose to pose during dialogue and blink.
-The music keeps getting stuck in my head and is pleasant to listen to, there are quite a few different tracks to suit the different moods and they're also very well done.
-All of the routes are very different from one another, so playing a new route isn't a 'oh, this again' experience excluding the prologue. I haven't played many otome aside from free to plays, but the routes here seem to be very unique. [spoiler] Never have I ever been locked in a dog cage by my boyfriend[/spoiler].
-Gosh, do I love the characters. Maybe they wont all be everyone's cup of tea [spoiler]specifically Toma[/spoiler] but I found most the characters to be interesting and likeable.
-Voice acting!!! I do love me some voice acting and Amnesia has it, professional voice acting even! I didn't find that any of the voice actors got annoying throughout my play, though I did find some voice actors to be better than others. Waka's voice actor specifically shone to me despite him being a side-characer.
-There were a few mysterys here and there- heck, one of the routes is essentailly a murder mystery without the murder. I found them enjoyable enough and finding out things bit by bit feels like putting together a puzzle.
-You can name your character whatever you want, which is nice.
-Choices you've already picked are highlighted green when you play through again.

NEGATIVES
-As gorgeous as the character models are if they don't move for a while or if your making a tough desicion it feels like they're staring into your soul. Also the necks look a bit weird, specifically Shin's.
-The same music tracks are used throughout ALL of the routes, so some of the more common everyday songs can be a bit boring after a while.
-...[spoiler]Toma's route. Just. Toma's route. It can be very polarizing and off-putting, not mention how immoral it all is! I get some people are into that but honestly, Toma's the worst TuT[/spoiler]
-Cheesy dialogue at times. I suppose that's common in otome though.
-Rina, as I called her, doesn't have a voice. Maybe it's just me who's disappointed by that, but I found it a bit off-putting.
-I experienced quite a bit of lag while playing, nothing game breaking but enough to make switching between screens and menus a bit irking.

TIPS (some spoilers? maybe?)
-Don't start with the diamond world. Any of the other three routes would be good to start with but I feel that the Dimond world gives away too much for the other worlds and is too polarizing for a first route.
-Save at the end of the prologue when you're offered the choice of which world you want to go to, it saves time when you want to start a new route.
-The 'S' button is the shortcut to skip dialogue you've already read, which is useful for trying to get different endings in routes you've already completed.
-If you really want to wrap up the story you have to get the good ends in all four worlds[spoiler]which then unlocks the fifth world, Joker world[/spoiler].

[spoiler]Kent is best route, Toma's route can burn, Orion is practically my son at this point and poor Ukyo deserves all the cookies- Enjoy.[/spoiler]

24768323.review:
Recommending because if you're looking for the otome experience, look no further. As far as otomes go, Amnesia: Memories is as much of an otome as you can get. Unfortunately this meant putting up with bland conversations, exasperating males, and a frustratingly bland protagonist. I'm forcing myself to play this for completion, but this is a long game. As of this review I've finished two routes.

Character art: 9/10   } Very shiny, very pretty. All characters have lovely art, not just the husbandos.

Background art: 2/10   } Simple background designs that look like an architecture student finished half a blueprint and left.

CGs: 7/10   } Good quality CGs, but I can't stop laughing at the noses haha.

Music: 5/10   } Standard VN music.

Wingman(s): 10/10   } Frankly speaking, Orion's the only reason why I didn't give up this game. You go, Orion!

Voice acting: 8/10   } Probably the reason why the game costs so much. Good voice acting.

Route(s): 4/10   } Spoilers below for why.

[SPOILERS START]
Ikki's route - good God I was just [i]waiting[/i] for this route to end. Ikki looks cool but is a broken record and completely unchanging. Early bad end incites rage, other early bad end feels like a horror game. The satisfaction of the good end barely outweighs the frustration of having to put up with him for the rest of the route.
Toma's route - I have no words for this. Toma's route is a topic that splits people into two clear parties. Sorry Toma, but that was too much.

Get Amnesia: Memories while it's on sale, and enjoy your pure otome.

24725603.review:
Купив с большой скидкой и собравшись с духом я всё-таки прошла свою первую[strike] и последнюю [/strike] отоме новеллу! В принципе, что можно ждать от любой истории из категории «седзе»? Правильно, наивно-ванильную романтическую драму для девушек лет эдак 15 со всеми возможными характерными штампами для жанра. И Amnesia тому пример. Это и старые друзья, которые втайне влюблены в героиню, и бабник, который только и мечтает о ней же, это хождение вокруг да около и т. п., но все-таки в отличие от обычных симуляторов свидания здесь есть явный плюс – отсутствие этого симулятора. В самом начале нам дается выбрать "мир" посвященный одному куну, где рассказывается история. Даже есть (внимание!) ОТЕ, а для меня это всегда было большим плюсом. Очень много внимание уделено «мальчикам», при этом о второстепенных персонажах благополучно забывают, и они присутствуют исключительно ради фона. Можно было бы уделить время и им. Музыка исключительно "чтобы что то звучало" и поэтому совсем не запоминатеся. Дизайн персонажей слишком уж странный. Мягко говоря, сильно сомневаюсь, что в Японии так кто-то ходит, как и в любой другой стране.  Дизайнер слишком уж постарался сделать их запоминающимися. По поводу языка - английский здесь элементарный, поскольку описание совсем отсутствует. Если кто-то его только учит или хочет подтянуть – очень советую, для начинающих вообще самое-то.

Если суммировать свое впечатление от первой из такого рода новелл, то я явно ожидала худшего. Получила не напрягающую, иногда наивную историю с драмой, что в принципе иногда тоже не плохо. Пойдет исключительно для женской половины человечества. Решила пересмотреть свое отношение к отоме и дать ей еще шанс.
О, и да, пропуск на s? Серьезно?

24696365.review:
Amnesia Memories is a visual novel otome game that you'll surely remember forever! There was never a dull moment for me when playing this game, theres countless things to explore and many ways to play the game. Also, with each route, there will be a good ending, a normal ending and a bad ending (Sometimes theres more than just one bad ending, so be prepared) Not going to lie, sometimes I feel like the normal endings are just as terrible as the bad endings; You should definately strive for the good endings in all routes though. There's four guy's routes in the beginning, but if you stay until the end you'll be able to enter a special world and get a true ending! 
When I first started playing this game I was hopelessly obsessed, there's something like a magnetic attraction that charms and pulls you into all the little odds and ends of this game.. With each guy, there's different personality; you're bound to find the one you like. Within the four main routes, the heroine will experience different instances; some lovely, sympathetic, scary or even questionable.. Its all in how you want to interpret the many feelings of this game. Amnesia Memories is also a very humorous game, It's fun to see how things turn out in the end since choices really do matter. 
Overall, Amnesia Memories is a gem of a game, don't miss out.. Solid 10/10. If you're still contemplating on buying this game, be sure to have one to multiple boxes of tissues close by, you might just cry a river. (It's better safe than sorry)

24695360.review:
"The mouth isn't the only way to supply nourishment."

Orion is Tyler Durden!...or god...short: imagination.



You play a female college student that suffers from no neurological or psychological (..."psychological" is just generalized bullshitting of those who are too lazy to even study Eric Kandel´s "Principles of Neuroscience"...but still pretend that their college degree is worth something...Trump University level it is...but I digress...) loss of "memories" but because a "spirit" called "Orion" miraculously came into your system and replaced them. This spirit tells you that nobody would believe you if you´d tell someone about it (First rule of the fight club...). Together with this imaginary spirit-friend you try to reconstruct your past and thus regain power over your present. 

+ nice graphics (the eyes look evil if you get too close...)
+ mellow background sound (I literally dozed away a few times just by listening to it...and I only played for about a bit over one hour for now) which is the main reason for triggering emotions.
+ easy savegame system
+ 5 male main characters (Toma, Shin, Kent, Ikki and Ukyō) which branch out into even more good, neutral and bad endings.

Copied from Wikipedia: 

"Amnesia is classified as an otome game; like most otome games, the player takes the role of a female character who can choose from a variety of male characters as her 'love interest'.

In Amnesia, the male characters that the female character can interact with are based on the symbolic suit symbols from a card deck with the following storylines (commonly known as 'routes') in the game: Heart, Spade, Clover, Diamond and Joker. Depending on which route is chosen, the player's relationship with each character is different."

- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amnesia_(visual_novel)#Gameplay

Могу сказать, что она стала для меня своего рода эталоном игр этого жанра.
Сюжет на высоте, эмоциональное напряжение ключевых сцен оставит равнодушным редкого фаната VR; отрисовка радует глаз, озвучка - слух; в предлагаемом количестве вариантов выбора можно потеряться (если, конечно, не наблюдать за показаниями приборной панели).
Описывать и восторгаться могу долго, но рекомендую пройти её всем начинающим поклонникам жанра.
За всю игру имею только два замечания:
- ошибки/опечатки английского текста;
- одинаково безучастный вид лица героини почти на всех изображениях;
- три ветки начинаются с одних и тех же диалогов, что к сожалению, не учтено производителем, потому что варианты выбора после прохождения одной из них заранее подсвечены в остальных двух. =-(

24528691.review: I watched the anime first and even that didn't spoil the fun - actually it enhanced it. Amnesia is very atmospheric, and each character's route is unique, slowly completing the puzzle that is the MC's mysterious predicament. The routes are not only unique, but also capable of getting the player emotionally involved with (almost) all characters' backstories. There are now quite a few otome games available for the Western market, most of them developed by westerners themselves and in English. However for those of us that really want to play Japanese Otome, the offerings are still very few. Amnesia does not dissapoint, it is excellent and what we all expect. A couple of things *are* missing, for me at least: 1) a little more darkness (the anime had me on the edge of my seat with some characters that were evidently innocent in the game playthrough); 2) a little bit more sexiness to the game. I guess the Western market is still a ways away from getting something more R-rated available for the female players. :( :( :( Are you reading, Sugar Beans? <3 Regardless of this, 100% recommend. And thank you to Idea Factory for localizing this title!

24302196.review:
A brief record of my first impressions:

First Route: Oh, this is actually a pretty solid whodunit. Shin's going all Agatha Christie here. Let's see if I can - nope, not them. Guess I'm getting the normal ending.

Second Route: Huh, this is a completely different story. Everything seems to be going fine - *gets shoved off a cliff*

Third Route: Okay, Kent is a totally reasonable dude, I can work with this, I think I've got this - *gets dropped off a roof*

Fourth Route: Uh, Toma seems pretty creepy here but I'm sure he's just - OH. OH GEEZ. *fate worse than death* OK WAIT BUT WHAT IF I *gets dropped down a well*

I might be bad at this game. But seriously, it doesn't pull any punches, and it has some interesting layers to it. It's really almost more of a mystery game than anything else. A few notes, from the perspective of someone unfamiliar with the genre:

PROS:
- Overall story and character development are generally well done
- Interesting variance between the stories; some things remain fairly constant, other things... don't
- Stylistic choices work well (minimalistic backgrounds, card game theme)
- Artwork is reasonably good and use of it in key moments is well executed

CONS:
- Orion is basically Navi
- Choices can feel very limited at times and the story gets a bit railroady in some places

Also keep the difficulty in mind - if you enjoy having to work for a good (or even a normal!) ending, you'll likely appreciate it, but if you get tilted by a bad ending, you might want to be wary. Having grabbed this largely due to the 90% off / very positive reviews combination, I was worried it might not be my style at all, but it's simply a well-designed game and worthy of a recommendation even to those who don't usually venture into this genre.

24266031.review:
For all the jokes my friends kept taunting me with for saying I am playing Amnesia and dating hot guys instead of running away from barrels, illuminated by a solitary oil lamp, I finally have to write a review to give this game justice.

And well, get back to reviewing stuff now that university is over, lolololol.

This otome is one of the best I've played so far, if not THE best amongst the paid ones. I've been checking out some free games from NaNoReno challenges and let me tell you - storylines in some of the free stuff FAR surpass the scripts of paid content. But, Amnesia is a great story, great gameplay and great experience, and a benchmark I use against any new otome games I want to play. I got it last autumn when it initially went on the big -90% sale, and I believe you really should be on a look-out for it as it has been done again for the Summer Sale, and you could have snatched the title for mere 2 quid instead of paying over 22 pounds.

[h1] ART STYLE[/h1] 
The sprites are beautiful! And I really mean it when I say beautiful. Each guy is very distinctive, with their flair of style, set of clothes and colours. Supporting characters are unique as well, easily recognizable in each route. Even though some people complain about the backgrounds, I actually like the Photoshop, minimalist style of them - considering the careful design of characters, you'd get a headache if everything was just as detailed. Apart from that - expressions! The changing poses (although, I have to say this, most times Shin and Ikki look AWEFUL facing back, and some of Ikki's CGs look as if he was a different person altogether, with very wonky features. It's been a let-down for me, as I've seen art from later Amnesia games and he looked good in them, not only when facing front. Oh well, can't have Medusa eyes beautiful from all angles, right?). The change in lighting and colours is a very good touch as well, "sunset setting" is done really well, as well as when night comes around and the whole colour scheme of backgrounds changes. BEAUTIFUL.

[h1] CHARACTERS[/h1] 
So far I've found two of my favourites, and have been constantly replaying their routes, with Shin first and now Ikki settled as my fav, fav, FAV character for a long while. Each guy has their own problems, quirks and things you are going to learn about them only if pursuing them directly, I really like the setting of having separate worlds and interacting with recurring characters in different circumstances. For once, Ikki made a "whatever" impression on me outside of his own route but baby, in his own - GOLD, GOLD, GOLD SWEET BABY. 

And it's really satisfying [spoiler] to be able to call Toma  a pervert and have Ikki nearly fight him, too. #neverforget #cageisnotmysafespace [/spoiler] 

[h1] CHOICES[/h1] 
Visual novels rely mostly on your own control over the story, and I find the choices here pretty varied, and actually compelling. Endings are really good overall, although true ones could be potentially more romantic. BAD ENDS however, oh MAN. I LOVE THEM. THEY'RE SO SICK. Like, really, really bad. It's no "oh man I'm lonely blah, blah", it's actual shit going down, [spoiler] characters getting murdered, your memory not returning, backstabbing [/spoiler] , and other drama, Bad ends are actually one of the reasons I use Amnesia as a benchmark while judging other games - it's an art to make bad choices entertaining, and have people investigate all options. Some of them are hidden so well, I had to resort to Let's plays to even notice what pattern you should have taken to even start on their route of destruction The menu is really helpful to keep track of all those already opened, or still left to witness.

[h1] ADDITIONAL CONTENT[/h1] 
There are two mini-games within the main menu you can play, some of the CGs are interactive where you can hear more from the characters "in that exact moment" after poking them a lot, and there are so called "Memories" that I find most entertaining of this bunch. It's the defining moment in each route that you can replay to learn more about the guy in that highlighting moment, and it's really, really sweet! Only after completing the route do they open, I believe, and only after checking them out will you realize the normal playthrough kind of omits the stuff said without losing an ounce of the romance. Clever screenwriting, I have to say, because it is essentially cut content you only notice missing after having played a Memory.

[h1] OVERALL[/h1] 
Even though the trope of an amnesiac MC is an overused trope, this was the first game for me with it (lucky me!) and so it did not feel straining to go through the motions and the journey of reclaiming them. Guys are awesome, choices do matter, your heroine is actually pretty well rounded for not having memories for much of the playthrough - what I mean, is that you learn from interactions with the guys how mostly independent and level-headed she's been up to her amnesia, which is really nice for a change. I am currently playing OZMAFIA!!, and let me tell you - the MC in Amnesia is a Terminator compared to the MC there, who is simply an idiot that goes rogue against your own choices, fair and square.
Amnesia is much less frustrating in this regard, but I have not even fully unlocked a romance of OZMAFIA!! so yup, not gonna give up hope yet.

As said already, be on the lookout for promotions and discounts, as the premiere last year was a big success, and more high budget otomes have started appearing on Steam (OZMAFIA!! as one of the other key productions) ever since Amnesia got released. Rejoice, rejoice, dear otome brethren! Get on it if you want a really interesting story set in different worlds, AMAZING boyfriends (Ikki is the best, just put up with all the drama, and you'll see), CRAZY bad ends and really pretty artwork.

Now I actually want to [spoiler] give Diamond World a spin now, even though I know all the spoilers craziness within, [/spoiler]  but I miss the edginess of Amnesia. It's a hilariously dark and frightening world the more you think about it, and the more you learn about their problems. So yup, recommend, recommend!
